subject: Hyper-V: Fixes unsupported 'TRUNK' endpoint mode
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-17 00:49:00.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/utils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Hyper-V: Fixes unsupported 'TRUNK' endpoint mode

Checks if the 'TRUNK' endpoint mode is in the
SupportedEndpointModes before setting the
DesiredEndpointMode. If it is not supported,
log an error instead and skip this step.

This way, the Hyper-V Neutron Agent won't be stuck
in exceptions while processing this port. It can
continue to bind other ports (ports on a flat
network won't encounter this issue).

Closes-Bug: #1422449

Change-Id: I823f9b88a533204b704b9eb28381022cc56a8e69

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes unsupported 'TRUNK' endpoint mode

Checks if the 'TRUNK' endpoint mode is in the
SupportedEndpointModes before setting the
DesiredEndpointMode. If it is not supported,
log an error instead and skip this step.

This way, the Hyper-V Neutron Agent won't be stuck
in exceptions while processing this port. It can
continue to bind other ports (ports on a flat
network won't encounter this issue).

Closes-Bug: #1422449

Change-Id: I823f9b88a533204b704b9eb28381022cc56a8e69
(cherry picked from commit 7301acf0b6460a840fd7394a6dc1488f3dd8c6a2)

commit_message:
Adds SecurityGroupRule and Generator

SecurityGroups Driver has proven difficult to maintain,
mainly because of the feature works quite differently on
Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012 and Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012 R2
and different cases and exceptions on both systems.

This commit adds the base classes needed to refactor
Security Groups.

Change-Id: I99fa8cfae2d105d89be930c2129405aff7fa3426
(cherry picked from commit 4bdfb93fb2c38875e6e18f98b083a90d32c5eb83)

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes unsupported 'TRUNK' endpoint mode

Checks if the 'TRUNK' endpoint mode is in the
SupportedEndpointModes before setting the
DesiredEndpointMode. If it is not supported,
log an error instead and skip this step.

This way, the Hyper-V Neutron Agent won't be stuck
in exceptions while processing this port. It can
continue to bind other ports (ports on a flat
network won't encounter this issue).

Closes-Bug: #1422449

Change-Id: I823f9b88a533204b704b9eb28381022cc56a8e69

subject: Removing disk_free_limit from rabbitmq conf
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-16 18:47:42.000000000', 'files': ['cue/templates/install_rabbit.sh.tmpl'], 'message': 'Removing disk_free_limit from rabbitmq conf

disk_free_limit is set to mem_relative, which is a value relative
to memory. mem_relative is currently broken in rabbitmq 3.2.x.
http://rabbitmq.1065348.n5.nabble.com/disk-free-limit-mem-relative-1-0-td36187.html

There is no use for this config. This config was added due to legacy product.

Change-Id: I94ee009827b2d97a124e031824462426469d317f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Removing disk_free_limit from rabbitmq conf

disk_free_limit is set to mem_relative, which is a value relative
to memory. mem_relative is currently broken in rabbitmq 3.2.x.
http://rabbitmq.1065348.n5.nabble.com/disk-free-limit-mem-relative-1-0-td36187.html

There is no use for this config. This config was added due to legacy product.

Change-Id: I94ee009827b2d97a124e031824462426469d317f

commit_message:
Move to a single unified parser for requirements.

This gets rid of potential inconsistency points between global
handling and per-file handling.

Change-Id: Ia24fd7d213fa6363f16d70c8ef798b7b67e4de4c

commit_message:
Adds SecurityGroupRule and Generator

SecurityGroups Driver has proven difficult to maintain,
mainly because of the feature works quite differently on
Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012 and Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012 R2
and different cases and exceptions on both systems.

This commit adds the base classes needed to refactor
Security Groups.

Change-Id: I99fa8cfae2d105d89be930c2129405aff7fa3426

subject: Find root stack ID with database operations
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-17 00:30:36.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/engine/resources/aws/ec2/instance.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/tests/test_server.py', 'heat/objects/stack.py'], 'message': 'Find root stack ID with database operations

This change adds a (currently unused) database function
stack_get_root_id to find the root stack ID for any stack.

Scheduler hints are moved to using Stack.root_stack_id() in this change.
Remaining uses of Stack.root_stack() will switch to using
Stack.root_stack_id() later in the series.

Change-Id: I9914b0df5af119edea6346db0d7c62124fbb1313
Partial-Bug: #1455589
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Find root stack ID with database operations

This change adds a (currently unused) database function
stack_get_root_id to find the root stack ID for any stack.

Scheduler hints are moved to using Stack.root_stack_id() in this change.
Remaining uses of Stack.root_stack() will switch to using
Stack.root_stack_id() later in the series.

Change-Id: I9914b0df5af119edea6346db0d7c62124fbb1313
Partial-Bug: #1455589

commit_message:
Introduce public_url, internal_url and admin_url

This change deprecates the following parameters:
- port (replaced by public/internal/admin_url)
- public_protocol (replaced by public_url)
- public_address (replaced by public_url)
- internal_protocol (replaced by internal_url)
- internal_address (replaced by internal_url)
- admin_protocol (replaced by admin_url)
- admin_address (replaced by admin_url)

Add deprecation warnings if any of those values are provided
while maintaining full backward compatibility.

Closes-bug: #1274979
Change-Id: Iac152347534874f8763d8df4f81d1568d3c5e222

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-10 21:02:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add VIF plug verification to deploy

WIP: Still need to add unit tests

The VIF plugging operation is intended to be an atomic operation for the
VM, and it needs to complete before the VM is booted.  When using
Neutron networks, some of the operation (specifically the bridging) is
done asynchronously.

When Neutron finishes, it sends an event indicating that the operation
has completed.

This change set updates the PowerVM driver to listen for the event and
fail if it does not come in.  If Nova Networks are in place, then no
event will come back.  The code supports this scenario as well.

Change-Id: Ibb4bc519a8c07d2879d22b5206d961eb99a9b63c

commit_message:
Add VIF plug verification to deploy

The VIF plugging operation is intended to be an atomic operation for the
VM, and it needs to complete before the VM is booted.  When using
Neutron networks, some of the operation (specifically the bridging) is
done asynchronously.

When Neutron finishes, it sends an event indicating that the operation
has completed.

This change set updates the PowerVM driver to listen for the event and
fail if it does not come in.  If Nova Networks are in place, then no
event will come back.  The code supports this scenario as well.

Change-Id: Ibb4bc519a8c07d2879d22b5206d961eb99a9b63c

commit_message:
Introduce public_url, internal_url and admin_url

This change deprecates the following parameters:
- version (replaced by public/internal/admin_url)
- port (replaced by public/internal/admin_url)
- public_protocol (replaced by public_url)
- public_address (replaced by public_url)
- internal_protocol (replaced by internal_url)
- internal_address (replaced by internal_url)
- admin_protocol (replaced by admin_url)
- admin_address (replaced by admin_url)

Add deprecation warnings if any of those values are provided
while maintaining full backward compatibility.

Closes-bug: #1274979
Change-Id: I52ed1e7bd9315bfc3b4d4b331ff8c4006654ea3c

commit_message:
Deprecate old public, internal and admin parameters

This change deprecates the following parameters:
- port (replaced by public/internal/admin_url)
- public_protocol (replaced by public_url)
- public_address (replaced by public_url)
- internal_protocol (replaced by internal_url)
- internal_address (replaced by internal_url)
- admin_protocol (replaced by admin_url)
- admin_address (replaced by admin_url)

Add deprecation warnings if any of those values are provided
while maintaining full backward compatibility.

Closes-bug: #1274979
Change-Id: Ia20f9d032fada10979383446f78ff57035b9c763

commit_message:
Add last_request_id only if it is not none

Noticed this while porting python-novaclient and we don't
seem to have a test case for last_request_id in general :(

Change-Id: Ia83ef6136da1c551ea947679dc546a0d7ad2f876

subject: Add a call back to the update port status
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-12 21:08:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a call back to the update port status

After a successful update of the PVID, the port status in neutron needs
to be updated to indicate that the port is now alive.  This change set
adds that function.

A future change set will be added to also tie this to the VLAN
bridging, as those two actions are truly required to indicate that
the port is completely configured.

Change-Id: I401876b08a4b25fa7211fee6f595ec392313ca5a

commit_message:
Add a call back to the update port status

Once a port has been successfully provisioned, the status of the device
in Neutron needs to be updated.  This means that it can not be done
until the Network Bridge is ready for the traffic and the Client Network
Adapter is running on the correct VLAN.

There are a couple hooks to keep in mind.  First, the port is
provisioned as soon as Nova ties it to a host.  This allows us to
immediately plug it into the Network Bridge.  However, the second hook
is to the VIF (in the PowerVM scenario - the Client Network Adapter)
where we must update the PVID.  This is done asynchronously, only able
to be done when Nova creates the VIF.

To properly update the device status, it must not be done until both the
Network Bridge and the Client Network Adapter are updated.

This change set ties the overall provision path to set the status down
if the immediate action (Network Bridge provision) fails.  Then the
PVIDLooper will update the specific device up/down depending on its
result.  This maintains the lifecycle flow and allows for proper
updating of the device status back to Neutron.

Change-Id: I401876b08a4b25fa7211fee6f595ec392313ca5a

commit_message:
Change status code from 500 to 400 for image update request

Invalid 'op' (operation) value provided for image update PATCH request
results in raising Internal Server Error (500). There is no helpful
information what went wrong and how to fix this particular request.
Proposed fix change the status code from 500 to 400 and return proper
message, so the user won't be confused and will be able to adjust the
request.

Change-Id: Ie20a3f350cbaa46c558b4e49b46091d1e4a74807
Closes-Bug: 1456157

- public_address (replaced by public_url)
- public_port (replaced by public_url)
- internal_address (replaced by internal_url)
- admin_address (replaced by admin_url)

Add deprecation warnings if any of those values are provided
while maintaining full backward compatibility.

Closes-bug: #1274979

commit_message:
Introduce public_url, internal_url and admin_url (and v3/ec2)

Introduce the following new parameters:
- public_url
- internal_url
- admin_url
- public_url_v3
- internal_url_v3
- admin_url_v3
- ec2_public_url
- ec2_internal_url
- ec2_admin_url

Deprecate the following parameters:
- compute_version: replaced by public/internal/admin_url(_v3)
- compute_port: replaced by public/internal/admin_url
- public_protocol: replaced by public_url and ec2_public_url
- public_address: replaced by public_url
- public_protocol: replaced by internal_url and ec2_internal_url
- internal_address: replaced by internal_url
- admin_protocol: replaced by admin_url and ec2_admin_url
- admin_address: replaced by admin_url
- ec2_port: replaced by ec2_public/ec2_internal/ec2_admin_url
- ec2_public_address: replaced by ec2_public_url
- ec2_internal_address: replaced by ec2_internal_url
- ec2_admin_address: replaced by ec2_admin_url

Add deprecation warnings if any of those values are provided
while maintaining full backward compatibility.

Co-Authored-by: Richard Raseley <richard@raseley.com>
Co-Authored-by: Hunter Haugen <hunter@puppetlabs.com>
Change-Id: Ie56bcbee22489817941fa7a023bb4ed649872df5
Closes-bug: #1274979

commit_message:
Add quota enforcement hook

Add a quota enforcement hook so quotas are enforced before
they reach the controller. This spot may need to be revisited
in the future if we want quotas enforced on internal AMQP APIs.

Change-Id: Ia5a134d941df921e44a413613ea11b636f4b8515
Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch

subject: Make tests pass on Puppet 4.x
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7155, 'name': 'Sebastien Badia', 'email': 'seb@sebian.fr', 'username': 'sbadia'}, {'_account_id': 7423, 'name': 'Cody Herriges', 'email': 'cody@herriges.org', 'username': 'ody'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-20 23:01:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make tests pass on Puppet 4.x

  This commit makes two changes: fixes the expected value in
  neutron_agents_dhcp_spec for the Package[dnsmasq-base] to
  ["Package[neutron-dhcp-agent]"] because Puppet 4.x cares and Puppet
  3.x is happy either way and in Class[neutron::params] makes sure
  operatingsystemrelease and operatingsystem both exist before comparing
  them against strings.

Change-Id: Ibb651f26f33549dbe564dc88167b8f578a03fd77
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-20 23:59:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make tests pass on Puppet 4.x

  This commit makes two changes: fixes the expected value in
  neutron_agents_dhcp_spec for the Package[dnsmasq-base] to
  ["Package[neutron-dhcp-agent]"] because Puppet 4.x cares and Puppet
  3.x is happy either way and so that Class[neutron::params] parses the
  commit adds default facts to each spec for operatingsystemrelease and
  operatingsystm because you can no longer compare non-existent
  variables to String type values.

Change-Id: Ibb651f26f33549dbe564dc88167b8f578a03fd77
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-05-21 00:19:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make tests pass on Puppet 4.x

  This commit makes two changes: fixes the expected value in
  neutron_agents_dhcp_spec for the Package[dnsmasq-base] to
  ["Package[neutron-dhcp-agent]"] because Puppet 4.x cares and Puppet
  3.x is happy either way and so that Class[neutron::params] parses the
  commit adds default facts to each spec for operatingsystemrelease and
  operatingsystm because you can no longer compare non-existent
  variables to String type values.

Change-Id: Ibb651f26f33549dbe564dc88167b8f578a03fd77
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-05-22 17:26:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make tests pass on Puppet 4.x

  This commit makes the following changes, mostly to specs to get them
  passing on Puppet 4.x: removes redefinition of $name because it is now
  a reserved word and redundant in Puppet 3.x, cleans up the use of
  Puppet's old behavior of implicitly converting String to Integers
  since Puppet 4.x is pretty strictly typed, sets facts required for
  doing flow control and comparison.

Closes-bug: #1447620
Change-Id: Ibb651f26f33549dbe564dc88167b8f578a03fd77
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-05-28 20:16:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make tests pass on Puppet 4.x

  passing on Puppet 4.x: removes redefinition of $name because it is now
  a reserved word and redundant in Puppet 3.x, cleans up the use of
  Puppet's old behavior of implicitly converting String to Integers
  since Puppet 4.x is pretty strictly typed, sets facts required for
  doing flow control and comparison, fixes implicit uses of empty string
  that are assumed to be the same as false.

Closes-bug: #1447620
Change-Id: Ibb651f26f33549dbe564dc88167b8f578a03fd77

  Puppet's old behavior of implicitly converting String to Integers
  since Puppet 4.x is pretty strictly typed, sets facts required for
  doing flow control and comparison, fixes implicit uses of empty string
  that are assumed to be the same as false, bumps the rspec-puppet
  version to 2.2.0 because a loader bug fixed in
  https://github.com/rodjek/rspec-puppet/commit/d4278834d5236deb497b84fbd937bc33e6a717a3,
  post the 2.1.0 release.

commit_message:
Make tests pass on Puppet 4.x

  This commit makes the following changes, mostly to specs to get them
  passing on Puppet 4.x: removes redefinition of $name because it is now
  a reserved word and redundant in Puppet 3.x, cleans up the use of
  Puppet's old behavior of implicitly converting String to Integers
  since Puppet 4.x is pretty strictly typed, sets facts required for
  doing flow control and comparison, fixes implicit use of empty string
  that is assumed to be the same as false by updating tests that inject
  empty string into params to represent a value not being provide by a
  user to false instead.

Closes-bug: #1447620
Change-Id: Ibb651f26f33549dbe564dc88167b8f578a03fd77

commit_message:
Sync up module with latest msync commit.

  Msync commit to push all our managed modules to the default set of
  configs.  Being done for two reason: to address a helper library
  loading issue that is addressed in
  https://github.com/rodjek/rspec-puppet/commit/d4278834d5236deb497b84fbd937bc33e6a717a3
  and to make all module contents consistent.

Change-Id: I747e589369a7ce187dc11c981f5d327af0cf73f5

commit_message:
Return the entire response in an InvalidResponse

It's much more helpful to return the entire response in an
InvalidResponse. It's already done this way in [1] and [2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/stackforge/python-openstacksdk/tree/openstack/auth/identity/v2.py#n95
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/stackforge/python-openstacksdk/tree/openstack/auth/identity/v3.py#n145

Change-Id: I007e0cfa726979a419808d47543a4260f8c3c584

commit_message:
Add ownership validation hook

Add hook to validate same ownership between objects that
aren't shared (e.g. port and network or port and subnet).

commit_message:
Avoid always saving flavor info in instance

Right now, _save_flavor() will always end up updating the instance_extra
record, even if nothing has changed. This is because this helper is always
called during save() and it doesn't avoid doing work if there is nothing to
do.

Closes-Bug: #1465799
Change-Id: I464f0a75c08df881457298bd9ccdb35220721b74

This patch dumps pretty_tox.sh and gets Cinder on board
with using ostestr.  We're setting a concurrency value
of 6 (instances in the gate are 6 VCPU's), and things

For folks running on 'smaller' system, it's still possible

take the last occurence of the conncurrency argument; so for
example if you specify "tox -epy27 -- --concurrency=4" the
interpretted value for concurrency in the run will be 4.

commit_message:
Remove pretty_tox and use ostestr

This patch dumps pretty_tox.sh and gets Cinder on board
with using ostestr.  We're setting a concurrency value
of 6 (instances in the gate are 6 VCPU's), and things
seem to be stable at this value.

For folks running on 'smaller' system, it's still possible
to run in parallell; > ncpu's but if there are problems you
can still specify concurrency in your tox argument.  Tox will
take the last occurence of the conncurrency argument; so for
example if you specify "tox -epy27 -- --concurrency=4" the
interpretted value for concurrency in the run will be 4.

Closes-Bug: #1459852

Change-Id: Iae12b42e915da22c863781015512df4f30aa95ca

commit_message:
Generate multiple baremetal MACs in sequence

Baremetal machines with multiple interfaces typically have their
MAC addresses in sequence. This patch updates configure-vm
so that each machine will have the baremetal MAC addressses
generated in sequence.

This fixes subtle ordering issues with bridges (and bonds)
which can use MAC address's when choosing a default interface.

Change-Id: Ibf1bb9af54dcd3bbe39ce4180c6817206c2c4352

Looks like if we switch to oslo.policy then we don't need any
files from oslo-incubator, so we just get rid of all of them.

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-04-29 08:24:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Disassociating of floating IPs corrected

Because of races floating IP address can be dealocated and at the same
time it can be associated with instance. To prevent appearing such orphan
floating IP addresses method 'deallocate_floating_ip' was synchronized
with 'associate_floating_ip', 'disassociate_floating_ip' methods.
Such synchronization is not enough for multinode environment.
That's why SQL requests for association, disassociation, dealication of
floating IP were updated with additional filters and SQL join statements.
SQL join was used to decrease number of SQL requests and therefore to
decrease possibility of races in these operations. Additional WHERE
clauses were added to reject operations under floating IP addresses
with wrong state (for example fixed_ip_id field in FloatingIp table
must be NULL to deallocate it)because at the same time it can be handled
by other node.

Closes-Bug: #1392923
Change-Id: I59fbad310fdb5ee67a872d97528221bd8ce5b3c2

commit_message:
Associating of floating IPs corrected

Due to race conditions, floating IP addresses can be deallocated
and at the same time it can be associated with instance. To
prevent such orphan floating IP addresses from appearing, SQL
requests for association and deallocation of floating IP was
updated with additional filters: deallocation can be done for
floating IP with empty fixed_ip_id field only, association is
allowed for floating IP with project_id that equal to current
context's project_id.

Closes-Bug: #1392923
Change-Id: I59fbad310fdb5ee67a872d97528221bd8ce5b3c2

apt ansible module. This change was done to ensure that the cache

commit_message:
Added apt update tasks to everything using apt

This change adds a specific update task to all tasks that all the
apt ansible module. This change was done to ensure that the cache
is updated as expected when instructed to do so. The reason that
the cache update is being removed from the grouping is because
there is an upstream bug that is effecting the process by which
the apt cache is updated when there is a package list to process
within the same task. The work around to make this function as
expected is to move the update into its own task without a package
list.

Upstream Ansible bug:
  - https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: Ic06d89a76d772c12888b4bc4bbf147be58b0c150
Related-Bug: 1464771

commit_message:
Add resource/plugin identification hook

Adds a hook that identifies the resource type and
identifies the associated plugin (core or service).
Both are placed into the request context for use by
other hooks and the controller.

Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch
Change-Id: I90854c240e6e40e429d00945d7db8e96923f83f7

This fixes a problem with propose_translation_update.sh on
oslo.concurrency:

+ git reset -q oslo.concurrency/locale/en_GB/LC_MESSAGES/oslo.concurrency-log-error.po
fatal: ambiguous argument
'oslo.concurrency/locale/en_GB/LC_MESSAGES/oslo.concurrency-log-error.po': unknown revision or path not in the working tree.
Use '--' to separate paths from revisions, like this:
'git <command> [<revision>...] -- [<file>...]'

Add the "--" to separate paths to handle deleted files as well.

Change-Id: Ifbce50bd851ea0028ebbb948e5173bda5777fc43
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix filter_commit in common_translation_update.sh

This fixes a problem with propose_translation_update.sh on
oslo.concurrency:

+ git reset -q oslo.concurrency/locale/en_GB/LC_MESSAGES/oslo.concurrency-log-error.po
fatal: ambiguous argument
'oslo.concurrency/locale/en_GB/LC_MESSAGES/oslo.concurrency-log-error.po': unknown revision or path not in the working tree.
Use '--' to separate paths from revisions, like this:
'git <command> [<revision>...] -- [<file>...]'

Add the "--" to separate paths to handle deleted files as well.

Change-Id: Ifbce50bd851ea0028ebbb948e5173bda5777fc43

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for quota_usage_update

This patch removes hard-code permission checks for quota_usage_update.
quota_usage_update is only called by Quota.usage_reset, and nowhere call
this usage_reset, so we can remove the hard-code permission checks directly.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: Ie0ef2369de4fe44c24bbf8cbb703caef115113a9

commit_message:
Fix functional post test_hook

1) Set correct $CINDERCLIENT_DIR to make Jenkins happy
2) Set OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION=2 to run with Cinder API v2 on gates

Change-Id: Id6be541fa2862eb833ed645e42bedcac6cef19dd

commit_message:
Apply a naming rule of GET to compute clients(n*)

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to compute clients which name is "networks".

In addition, this patch moves "name" filter of list_networks
to caller side because this filter is used at one place.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ic2f7b8a2724035f0b2cd9def13cd7f7fc1e9924d

switched from db_create_with_user to lwrp openstack_common_database

- replaced db_create_with_user with lwrp from common
- utilized new common attribute openstack.common.services to
dry recipe

commit_message:
Libvirt: Hypervisor statistic should only sum up once per shared storage.

Hypervisor reports statistics by gathering resources of all compute nodes
in the system. This behavior is uncorrect in case some of compute nodes
share the same storage. The solution is to use libvirt to check if compute
node uses shared storage or not, then report to resource_tracker.
With compute nodes use shared storage, only add their resources once.

Closes-Bug: #1252321
Change-Id: Ia6711f14643b65e55825e8377b93dfbd837a813e

commit_message:
Add hook to create a context from the headers

Adds a hook to parse the HTTP headers and turn them into a
Neutron context. The context is then attached to the thread-local
request object so future hooks and the controller can operate on it.

Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch

commit_message:
Flexible IP allocations for isolated nets

This patch adds new '<net name>AllocationPool' parameters
to all of the isolated network nested stacks so that users
can easily control the allocation ranges on these networks.

Change-Id: I44b564831446c62e3489a69d992e0fb1f642b085

commit_message:
Make get-image.sh bashate compliant

Make get-image.sh bashate compliant by creating a file in /tmp
for the ifcfg temporary file and using the --upload command instead
of the --runcommand operation.

Change-Id: I4782140e227105f9aa07fb3967665eaaaeeb0cab
Partially-implements: blueprint bashate-gate

commit_message:
Disallow backing files when uploading volumes to image

Volumes with a header referencing a backing file can leak
file data into the destination image when uploading a
volume to an image.

Halt the upload process if the volume data references a
backing file to prevent this.

Closes-Bug: #1415087
Change-Id: Iab9718794e7f7e8444015712cfa08c46848ebf78
(cherry picked from commit 9634b76ba5886d6c2f2128d550cb005dabf48213)
Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/test_image_utils.py (backport to old tests)
(cherry picked from commit d31c937c566005dedf41a60c6b5bd5e7b26f221b)
Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/test_image_utils.py

Revert "Revert "Set default of api_workers to number of CPUs""

This reverts commit 12a564cf03e612dda36df26df8d28dfc75f1af6e.

We should re-enable this feature on a controlled basis so that we can
flush out any outstanding issue we may have.

Related-bug: #1432189

commit_message:
Disallow backing files when uploading volumes to image

Volumes with a header referencing a backing file can leak
file data into the destination image when uploading a
volume to an image.

Halt the upload process if the volume data references a
backing file to prevent this.

Closes-Bug: #1415087
Change-Id: Iab9718794e7f7e8444015712cfa08c46848ebf78
(cherry picked from commit 9634b76ba5886d6c2f2128d550cb005dabf48213)
Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/test_image_utils.py (backport to old tests)

commit_message:
go: limit replication per disk

Change the concurrency model used by the object replicator.

It now launches a goroutine per drive, then uses a channel as a semaphore
around single partitions to limit concurrency.

The idea is to prevent replication workers from stacking up on a bad disk,
since it'll make that disk even worse, and also tie up the whole replicator.

Change-Id: I5bbee41398e60ee906df607e9a0d41503d6a9f9a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-15 23:04:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Handle InstanceNotFound when sending instance state update notification

When Tempest (or any automated client) is waiting for an instance to be
ACTIVE but goes to ERROR state, it immediately fails a test and deletes
the instance.  The instance could be deleted by the time the instance
state update notification processing happens so there is a race where
that could fail with InstanceNotFound.  That will get traced to the
conductor logs and we should try to keep the conductor logs as clean as
possible from expected exceptions.

This handles InstanceNotFound and just logs it at debug rather than
trace out the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1455640

Change-Id: Iaee147051afb59f7991f8dfef3bd3072c28f829d

ACTIVE but goes to ERROR state, it immediately fails a test and deletes
the instance.  The instance could be deleted by the time the instance
update notification processing happens so there is a race where that

logs and we should try to keep the conductor logs as clean as possible
from expected exceptions.

This handles InstanceNotFound and just logs it at debug rather than
trace out the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1455640

Change-Id: Iaee147051afb59f7991f8dfef3bd3072c28f829d
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Handle InstanceNotFound when sending instance update notification

When Tempest (or any automated client) is waiting for an instance to be
ACTIVE but goes to ERROR state, it immediately fails a test and deletes
the instance.  The instance could be deleted by the time the instance
update notification processing happens so there is a race where that
could fail with InstanceNotFound.  That will get traced to the conductor
logs and we should try to keep the conductor logs as clean as possible
from expected exceptions.

This handles InstanceNotFound and just logs it at debug rather than
trace out the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1455640

Change-Id: Iaee147051afb59f7991f8dfef3bd3072c28f829d

The libvirt volume driver disconnect_volume() method does not return

Change-Id: I82e28ae8f1b61e5132df1453673aa832073f964b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
libvirt: disconnect_volume does not return anything

The libvirt volume driver disconnect_volume() method does not return
anything so _disconnect_volume does not need to return None.  The return
value wasn't being used in places that call self._disconnect_volume()
anyway.

Change-Id: I82e28ae8f1b61e5132df1453673aa832073f964b

If false, then the default CA truststore is used for verification.

commit_message:
VMware: verify vCenter server certificate

Two configuration properties are being added:
'ca_file': Specify a CA bundle file to use in verifying the vCenter
server certificate
'insecure': If true, the vCenter server certificate is not verified.
If false, then the default CA truststore is used for verification.
This option is ignored if 'ca_file' is set.

Closes-Bug: #1276207

DocImpact

Change-Id: I86a04fbd70f726206ddd95caf87685f3559d2ad8

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-12 19:29:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Warn when CONF torrent_base_url is missing slash

The urlparse.urljoin(base, url) method will essentially ignore the base
URL if it does not contain a slash character. For example:

>>> urlparse.urljoin('foo.com', 'bar')
'bar'
>>> urlparse.urljoin('foo.com/', 'bar')
'foo.com/bar'
>>> urlparse.urljoin('http://foo.com', 'bar')
'http://foo.com/bar'

This is by design of RFC 1808 (see step 6 for details).

This patch improves the help message for the config option as well as
logs a warning when the base URL in the config file exists but does not
contain any slashes.

Change-Id: I0319f9382294223fcd68a493def3e71de7de3ba1

commit_message:
Warn when CONF torrent_base_url is missing slash

The urlparse.urljoin(base, url) method will essentially ignore the base
URL if it does not contain a slash character. For example:

>>> urlparse.urljoin('foo.com', 'bar')
'bar'
>>> urlparse.urljoin('foo.com/', 'bar')
'foo.com/bar'
>>> urlparse.urljoin('http://foo.com', 'bar')
'http://foo.com/bar'

This is by design of RFC 1808 (see step 6 for details).

This patch improves the help message for the config option as well as
logs a warning when the base URL in the config file exists but does not
contain any slashes.

Change-Id: I0319f9382294223fcd68a493def3e71de7de3ba1

commit_message:
Add hook to translate exceptions into HTTP codes

Adds a hook to catch neutron exceptions and translate them into
a corresponding HTTP error code. If no corresponding code is found,
an HTTP 500 is returned with the original exception logged so
internal state isn't leaked to the user.

Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch
Change-Id: Ia25733d6e394e034995890c806ed04e387d4ab58

commit_message:
Remove Fedora 20 as supported distribution

Fedora 20 will reach end of life on 23-JUN-2015[1]; remove it as
supported distribution. Add Fedora 22 where applicable.

    - stack.sh: Remove Fedora 20 from list of supported distributions.
    - files/rpms/general: Remove 'f20' from NOPRIME.
    - lib/ceph: Remove 'f20' from the check_os_support_ceph()
      function.
    - doc/source/index.rst: s/Fedora 20/Fedora 21/

[1] https://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/devel-announce/2015-May/001586.html

Change-Id: I8f2e1ddc24c071754b1cceb5bed5bdafdc9d9f79

commit_message:
Adding PLUMgrid plugin option to neutron

Taking advantage of the modularized neutron plays.
An option to use the plumgrid plumgin is added.

Added changes to include support for disabled neutron agents
and their respective playbooks

Implements: blueprint add-plumgrid-neutron-plugin

Change-Id: I331fe90d94f4e778ad0d60a226a4bed848c4d02b
Signed-off-by: Javeria Khan <javeriak@plumgrid.com>

commit_message:
Fix http 500 when no accept header passed to secret GET /payload

Update secrets controller to catch the situation where no Accept
http header value is passed (or a blank value is passed).

Default to application/octet-stream as the Accept: header is not
required.

Change-Id: Icb940df639fb98ee594e3a2b227ed3f753d28517
Closes-Bug: 1462681
(cherry picked from commit d0349286e779dfa2eb73ef9e02b7f0d2dab6d4f4)

commit_message:
Use ConfigFixture to ensure config settings are reverted

Update the test configuration management code to use a ConfigFixture so
that configuration changes are rolled back at the end of each test.

Also fix the initialization order in TestSwiftParams to ensure that the
base class is configured before local customizations are applied.

Change-Id: I27620e3d4caf95e2c75fbf2cf2716ae1337030c7

subject: Allow ceilometer to run in virtualenv if USE_VENV
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-05 18:49:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceilometer', 'files/apache-ceilometer.template'], 'message': "Allow ceilometer to run in virtualenv if USE_VENV

This requires three main changes:

* setting CEILOMETER_BIN_DIR appropriately
* running the various services with a full path
* explicitly installing optional python modules (for mongo and
  virt drivers, if configured) during the install phase

In the process of making this work it was discovered that setting
CEILOMETER_BACKEND to something like 'foo' would cause the backend
to be configured to use mongodb but for the mongodb system packages
and related python modules to not be installed. Fixing this was used
to validate the install process under USE_VENV.

Change-Id: I35fbfa76bdd60a22ba90b13666b06eeb961dddb3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow ceilometer to run in virtualenv if USE_VENV

This requires three main changes:

* setting CEILOMETER_BIN_DIR appropriately
* running the various services with a full path
* explicitly installing optional python modules (for mongo and
  virt drivers, if configured) during the install phase

In the process of making this work it was discovered that setting
CEILOMETER_BACKEND to something like 'foo' would cause the backend
to be configured to use mongodb but for the mongodb system packages
and related python modules to not be installed. Fixing this was used
to validate the install process under USE_VENV.

Change-Id: I35fbfa76bdd60a22ba90b13666b06eeb961dddb3

commit_message:
Set datapath to $OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE for bridges

This change extends devstack to configure the br-ex,
br-<phy> and Xenserver's br-$GUEST_INTERFACE_DEFAULT
datapaths when OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE is set.

Change-Id: I71e590de86e7526e8423140463752d6b3ad14214
Closes-Bug: #1416444

commit_message:
Cinder: On SUSE, avoid restarting tgt

There is a known bug that restart tgtd fails, so go the
workaround way and stopping/starting it instead.

In addition, remove the else case since unstack also
uses cleanup_cinder, which already unconditionally supports
all distros.

Change-Id: Ib70917a95f001ef36a51815f08416fa30084aad6

The guestagent API contained log messages and docstrings that
referenced MySql. With multi-datastore support, this API is
now db agnostic and the messages should reflect that.

as appropriate.

commit_message:
Fixed API string references to MySql

The guestagent API contained log messages and docstrings that
referenced MySql. With multi-datastore support, this API is
now db agnostic and the messages should reflect that.

Changed occurrences of "MySql" to "database" and fixed grammar
as appropriate.

Change-Id: Id44f0d6eda8c0ef1de1d77975713c34088bf302d
Closes-bug: 1445647

commit_message:
Add startup hook after pecan init for plugins

Add a startup method to initialize all of the plugins after the
pecan app is configured but before it is returned to guaruntee
that everything is ready before the app starts taking requests.

Change-Id: Id18ac5ab979b5f2cb49b69d8650248010e02fe76
Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch

commit_message:
Enable nova service by default

This commit updates the default value for enable for nova components to
default to true, instead of false. Without this
change the nova service is not enabled by default resulting in a
different behavior than with other puppet openstack modules.
Associated tests are updated to expect the change in defaults.

Change-Id: I3a1a2b4ff4dcaea992350fe42a7a1babc7b9d414
Closes-bug: #1220473

commit_message:
Enable nova service by default

This commit updates the default value for enable in nova api,
generic_service, compute, conductor and scheduler to true. Without this
change the nova service is not enabled by default resulting in a
different behavior than with other puppet openstack modules.
Associated tests are updated to expect the change in defaults.

Change-Id: I4c6186235449ccb7a8613ace9400e6cfc9048140
Closes-bug: #1220473

commit_message:
Disallow backing files when uploading volumes to image

Volumes with a header referencing a backing file can leak
file data into the destination image when uploading a
volume to an image.

Halt the upload process if the volume data references a
backing file to prevent this.

Closes-Bug: #1415087
Change-Id: Iab9718794e7f7e8444015712cfa08c46848ebf78

commit_message:
Revert "Allow admin user to get all tenant's floating IPs"

This reverts commit 02328d33373479b33f4fee8112d47c1ae29e8bd4.

As per the comments on the support all-tenants in floatingips-list
spec [1], this patch reverts the --all-tenants flag from
python-novaclient since support has been reverted out of Nova more
than a year ago.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/171389/

Change-Id: I2d6566ecf59d307e3ea117b3b20dc918c758b63e

commit_message:
Mark deprecation(s) to be removed in 6 + $version_created_in

Six versions after a function/method/other is deprecated should
be more than enough time for folks to move off of it so let's
set that as the removal_version for all existing deprecations.

Change-Id: Iab6f893ed8522c5b6518f001878e4b3e9a9c5b8e

commit_message:
Register global Keystone args first

As described in the referenced bug, registering the Keystone args
last causes their default values to be ignored.  Registering them
first seems to prevent the problem.

Change-Id: I8eb7882a0153fedbd6591dde2157df13fa2e5ba3
Closes-Bug: 1463581

commit_message:
ngReorg - Move API files to openstack_dashboard

This commit moves the Angular-based API services to the
openstack_dashboard directory.

It also simplifies the naming scheme for the Angular-based
API modules.

Fixes all JSCS issues in files that were modified by this patch.

This is one step in a larger effort to restructure the Angular
source. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176152/ for the
full set of planned changes.

Change-Id: I4200336508761fb0155be422ebcecd4bf2907035
Closes-Bug: #1446886

commit_message:
Fixes quota-class-update commands

The quota-class-update commands for v1 and v2 are both broken,
Fix v1 by returning result for update method in QuotaClassSetManager,
fix v2 by changing arg 'class-name' to 'class_name' for consistent
with v1.

Change-Id: Ic7188f485b914dc55048cf056a0685618134e87a
Closes-bug: #1423884

commit_message:
cinderclient deprecated endpoint_type needs dest=

Fix for https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-cinderclient/+bug/1453901 did
not set dest=os_endpoint_type for synonym endpoint_type

Change-Id: I98a8507f2369deff6a6f7f8f08271b169fe651ad
Closes-Bug: 1454436

subject: The is_public filter in VolumeTypeManager.list broke the find in VolumeTypeAccessManager, which caused all commands which should have taken a volume_type name to fail.  I have choosen to fix this by effectively removing the filter in the client (and the --all argument to type-list). This is OK, since Cinder implements the filtering by user anyway.  The consequence of this change is that the Admin user will always see the entire list (including private types) every time they execute type-list

commit_message:
The is_public filter in VolumeTypeManager.list broke the find in
VolumeTypeAccessManager, which caused all commands which should have taken
a volume_type name to fail.  I have choosen to fix this by effectively
removing the filter in the client (and the --all argument to type-list).
This is OK, since Cinder implements the filtering by user anyway.  The
consequence of this change is that the Admin user will always see the
entire list (including private types) every time they execute type-list

Change-Id: I5c9a693711db2918abbd3bbfae53e48162a01c3c
Closes-Bug: 1462104

subject: Close iterables at the end of iteration
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-10 21:23:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Close iterables at the end of iteration.

This fixes a bug where if iteration is interrupted, we're stuck until
the iterable is gc'd, which can be a very long time (e.g. if the
iterable is held in an exception stack frame).

Change-Id: Ibe9990e8c337c117a978b1cd8ec388c4bc6d3b4b
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-11 16:01:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Close iterables at the end of iteration

This fixes a bug where if iteration is interrupted, we're stuck until
the iterable is garbage collected, which can be a very long time (e.g. if
the iterable is held in an exception stack frame).

commit_message:
Close iterables at the end of iteration

This fixes a bug where if iteration is interrupted, we're stuck until
the iterable is garbage collected, which can be a very long time (e.g. if
the iterable is held in an exception stack frame).

Co-authored-by: Stuart McLaren <stuart.mclaren@hp.com>

Change-Id: Ibe9990e8c337c117a978b1cd8ec388c4bc6d3b4b
Closes-bug: 1461678

commit_message:
Document Compliant modules

We are in the process to move some modules under the big tent. Before
that, we need to agree which modules we want to support.

This patch document it beside our regular blueprints.

Change-Id: I8d0d663ff6ae4383b32a920df38ee51d1b60b9ce

commit_message:
Fix noVNC console access for an IPv6 setup

Following a recent change in websocket proxy code
(commit: fdb73a2d445971c6158a80692c6f74094fd4193a),
novnc console access is not working for IPv6 addresses.
This patch fixes the issue by taking into account the way
IPv6 urls are constructed and parsing them accordingly.

(cherry picked from commit 7d5cddf3e4351eaf406344baf20faccb1fef5f34)

Closes-Bug: #1456963
Change-Id: Ia6c50be1e3cbe8a21f0a75b6a7cebd1712d311f8

commit_message:
Rename project to openstacksdk

Prepare for the next release and set the package name to openstacksdk
and drop the python- prefix. This package name has already been reserved
on PyPI.

This was initially started by a discussion at the summit around
OpenStackClient making the same move to strip the python- prefix
(they haven't completed it, but have reserved the PyPI name).
It was further discussed on IRC and I believe in a meeting that
there is no benefit to having the python- prefix here. There is
no name collision we're avoiding with it, and it provides
nothing extra by being prefixed as such.

Change-Id: I1145883a2f896769143a3fcc6e43468d6e590e11

commit_message:
Initial pecan structure

This patch is the initial work for the pecan refactor.

* Adds pecan as a requirement
* Adds a simple API server named 'neutron-dev-server' for use
  when neutron server is not deployed in a web server
* Adds a basic V2 controller that breaks out requests by method
* Wraps the app with the openstack request ID middleware
* Adds functional tests to ensure request ID is set and requests
  are properly sent to the V2 controller.

Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch
Change-Id: Ic9697ff30ab8359b62ce01eb73dc927065a8e3e6

commit_message:
Remove ironic group from ironic-inspector

Having the ironic-inspector list the group ironic causes problems with
the gerrit to launchpad hooks, so the LP bug pages were not being
updated correctly.

Change-Id: I2b37fffd8dcac59c783ba523eacf64bc36ad55dc

Small fixes for running Nova services under Apache2

commit_message:
Nested Quota Driver

OpenStack is moving towards support for hierarchical
ownership of projects. In this regard, Keystone will
change the organizational structure of Openstack, creating
nested projects. The proposal is to develop a Nested quota
driver which will allow enforcing quotas in nested projects.

blueprint cinder-nested-quota-driver

Change-Id: Ic0cfee72b60146f0f78fe3ab37ae5e03ad90303f

commit_message:
Fix the problem with ceph deployment on scale lab

Postpone ceph pool creation to post deploy:
* Add task for ceph pool creation and put it in post deploy
* Change ceph/compute.pp and move to post deploy
* Remove from ceph/manifests/init.pp the pool creation code

Closes-bug: #1462451
Change-Id: Iee72e5f8e59c3ced0ba0d7f971380e5932cbb0fc

commit_message:
Focus-trap for modal dialog

When a modal dialog showing up, by design, user cannot click
on buttons and links under the overlay layer.  However when
pressing [tab]/[shift + tab] key, user still be able to navigate
the focus to any focusable elements in the page outside the
modal dialog, and interact on it via keyboard, this is not
desired. `focusTrap` service provides an elegant solution for
it.

This patch provides this feature, and applied it to wizard
widget.

Closes-Bug: 1432810
Change-Id: Ibcd4c6adec8f871523145f6a402bf3d63336303f

commit_message:
puppet-openstack: make vote beaker jobs

All our modules now have beaker tests.
That means jobs are green and we need them voting to keep our modules
stable and testable.

This patch enable voting on Beaker jobs for Puppet OpenStack modules
after Juno release (and still don't run them for Juno and before).
It also adds the jobs in the gate (it was only in check pipeline).

commit_message:
Share_server-pool mapping

Manila scheduler needs information about relationship between
pools and share_servers to make Manila scheduling decisions smarter,
as it would be based on pool capacity/capability.

Add new share driver method called 'get_share_server_pools'
which takes a share server and returns a list of pools.

Share manager calls that method for every share server on every stats update
and adds mapping to share_stats.

Add new function 'share_server_get_all_by_host' to DB API.

Change-Id: I41041cc247da5e25383c2f3f827d7d96b4347427

subject: Fix the devstack octavia plugin for non ubuntu distributions
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-16 11:24:57.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Fix the devstack octavia plugin for non ubuntu distributions

The plugin.sh script should refrain from using apt-get directly.
By doing so, package installation (in our case qemu and kpartx) fails
for non ubuntu distributions.

This Fix uses the install_package wrapper function, which is part of devstack.

Change-Id: Ie602fbb6f7a39ceff11354ee95d99fe1e267a4ed
Closes-Bug: 1465618
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix the devstack octavia plugin for non ubuntu distributions

The plugin.sh script should refrain from using apt-get directly.
By doing so, package installation (in our case qemu and kpartx) fails
for non ubuntu distributions.

This Fix uses the install_package wrapper function, which is part of devstack.

Change-Id: Ie602fbb6f7a39ceff11354ee95d99fe1e267a4ed
Closes-Bug: 1465618

commit_message:
[Sahara] More debug logging

The log entries added will allow a user to track if the benchmark is
waiting for something or it has stuck.

_is_cluster_active method is not required anymore with a new wait
method.

Change-Id: I6994e382818262d728723ad0b9f780fa2f6d3c3e

commit_message:
Improved wait_for benchmark helper

wait_for helper improved to handle and log the status changes of the
resource. wait_for now accepts active_statuses, failure_statuses and attribute
name to perform status checks on the resource.

The wait_for method change is backward compatible so the current usages
are not affected.

The new methods added to handle specific wait cases:
* wait_is_ready - old wait_for symantics. Checks a resource with a
user-provided is_ready callable
* wait_for_status - implements waiting for specific resource status.
Logs the status changes.

Change-Id: I04f917033a02ca21fa1ad6eb55fcdb727ce82090

commit_message:
Install data files in proper path

Bash completion script is installed in /usr/local/etc, so
install_rally.sh should make a symlink in /etc/bash_completion.d/

Also move `data_files` section from setup.py to setup.cfg

Closes-Bug: 1463038
Change-Id: Ifd5f69e41aa8121129d6314130385f48e1690843

There has been a long-standing race bug in the gate where adding a
floating IP to an instance fails with a 400 because instance.info_cache
is None.

commit_message:
Allow refreshing network info_cache in get_nw_info_for_instance

There has been a long-standing race bug in the gate where adding a
floating IP to an instance fails with a 400 because instance.info_cache
is None.

This change allows a caller to tell get_nw_info_for_instance to get the
latest network information from the network API if instance.info_cache
is not set.

A dependent change to the os-floating-ips extension will use this to
force the refresh if the network info_cache is not set on the instance
rather than error out.

Partial-Bug: #1249065

Change-Id: I326ffaaab941e9fb897a03da3512e4cb481e4a3e

commit_message:
Reduce dataloss window through interrupted writes.

If we're interrupted mid-file-update we shouldn't leave the
requirements file half written. Instead write to a temp file and
rename into place.

Change-Id: I7c7c2553b90f756d74df1967369732b21b8e8c0d

commit_message:
Force a refresh of the network info_cache if not set in os-floating-ips

There has been a long-standing race bug in the gate where adding a
floating IP to an instance fails with a 400 because instance.info_cache
is None.

This forces a refresh of the network info_cache on the instance if it's
not set when attempting to add a floating IP to the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1249065

Change-Id: Idce55c0d1d17d70d403e57996ea8c9c143e54d6f

commit_message:
Revert patch-set "VMware: remove unused parameter for VMOPS spawn"

As part of networking-vsphere(OVSvApp solution) project, we have a
customised nova VCDriver which is overriding the spawn method and
using the power_on parameter to support OVSvApp Solution.

Hence, reverting this commit If719b94cf50d5f2212eac4807c80edb886bf7808
to enable the solution.

Reference:
https://github.com/stackforge/networking-vsphere
https://github.com/stackforge/networking-vsphere/blob/master/
networking_vsphere/nova/virt/vmwareapi/ovsvapp_vc_driver.py#L53

Change-Id: Ibd209e32fb83a5da6f931ccc358c28c3e01a11c5

commit_message:
Log the actual instance.info_cache when empty in floating ip associate

This attempts to add some enlightenment to the case where we try to
associate a floating ip for an instance and hit the case where there
is no info_cache. We need to know if it's actually None, or empty.

Related-Bug: #1249065

Change-Id: Ic0051d1d520f800d845b7006b5b95be5d8edf7c9

[{'created': '2015-06-11 02:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute.pp', 'manifests/vncproxy/common.pp', 'manifests/vncproxy.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_vnc_proxy_spec.rb'], 'message': 'move setting of novncproxy_base_url

commit_message:
move setting of novncproxy_base_url

The fixes introduced in order to resolve
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1409142 (CVE-2015-0259) make
novncproxy_base_url relevant on hosts running the nova-novncproxy
service, whereas previously it was only used by nova-compute to
construct VNC console urls.

This change moves the setting of the novncproxy_base_url option out of
compute.pp and into nova::vncproxy_common, where it can be used both
by compute.pp and vncproxy.pp.

Change-Id: I7af4cf8257f2bdbc7d3cc57930fd6371571db531
(cherry picked from commit 28268ad9c74370b193efe8e972c808d76bb8c8d7)

commit_message:
Add Host Mapping table to API Database

This patch creates the host_mappings table in the API database for cellsv2.
This table will contain mapping of compute hosts to cells.

Change-Id: I1bd35434ce186e1fb49d56c621bff3f09aa90138
Implements: blueprint cells-host-mapping

driver in oslo.messaging.

commit_message:
Use monotonic lib. to avoid finding monotonic time function

That library already does this same/equivalent search and
ensures that a monotonically increasing time is made available
so we can just avoid looking around for it ourselves.

Depends-On: Ia802cf5bc605aa428596731d86d995e75d4fdd59

Change-Id: I6b99a3eb90c766ff73726170f61697fbfacad7bb

commit_message:
Set default pass in aio scripts to be random

In the bootstrap-aio.sh and osad-aio-heat-template.yml we use a default
password of "secrete". As a minor security concern, this patch adjusts
this to be random.

Change-Id: I54b9a085aba7845b7a9ad435c60604359921fc09
Closes-Bug: #1462000
(cherry picked from commit 888f0ec87adec9ff7b633755e30015b2e813e95c)

subject: Fix support for auth_uri setting in neutron provider
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-11 13:18:18.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/neutron.rb'], 'message': "Fix support for auth_uri setting in neutron provider

Neutron provider still uses auth_port and auth_host config
options even though those are now deprecated and won't be set
if someone chooses to use auth_uri. This commit adds support
for auth_uri and keeps the provider backwards compatible.


Change-Id: I4824c09e6af4a800b5ac0c22bf5daea99452bd7e
(cherry picked from commit 6fb01efe21669a1a2408ca7aba0efc421cb51bd9)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix support for auth_uri setting in neutron provider

Neutron provider still uses auth_port and auth_host config
options even though those are now deprecated and won't be set
if someone chooses to use auth_uri. This commit adds support
for auth_uri and keeps the provider backwards compatible.


Change-Id: I4824c09e6af4a800b5ac0c22bf5daea99452bd7e
(cherry picked from commit 6fb01efe21669a1a2408ca7aba0efc421cb51bd9)

commit_message:
Correct the disk usage report in resource tracker

Currently the disk consumption of eph disk is based on
'ephemeral_gb' in flavor and instance; however, it's not accurate
because the eph disk is created based on user's input.
If eph disk is not specified, the eph disk will be created according
to the 'ephemeral_gb', if it's specified, the 'ephemeral_gb' will be
used as maximum eph disk can be created.
The patch get the real eph disk consumption and use it when doing
update for system disk.

Change-Id: Ib668537e5472a9352261100726728193928b3512
Closes-Bug: #1315988

subject: Update requirements for stevedore
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-16 10:33:59.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Update requirements for stevedore

cliff requires pbr>=0.11,<2.0 but stevedore<1.5.0 requires
pbr>=0.6,!=0.7,<1.0 . That can't work for pbr versions >= 1.0.
So require at least stevedore>=1.5.0 which also requires
pbr>=0.11,<2.0.

Change-Id: I4706ebfc7ce78e04fbd0a83283dc0f4766f9a2a3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update requirements for stevedore

cliff requires pbr>=0.11,<2.0 but stevedore<1.5.0 requires
pbr>=0.6,!=0.7,<1.0 . That can't work for pbr versions >= 1.0.
So require at least stevedore>=1.5.0 which also requires
pbr>=0.11,<2.0.

Change-Id: I4706ebfc7ce78e04fbd0a83283dc0f4766f9a2a3

commit_message:
Conditionally expose resources based on roles

Use actual user roles to filter out from `resource-type-list` those resources
that current user can not create due to RBAC restrictions.

Specifies blueprint conditional-resource-exposure

Change-Id: Ic13c51ef04e8d6d740a46d9554267ada9d9c78d2

commit_message:
Conditionally expose resources based on services

Use endpoint list to filter out those actually unavailable resources
from `resource-type-list` and make templates containing them
fail faster at validation.

Spesifies blueprint keystone-based-resource-availability

Change-Id: I48553873294b4aedfad2fc722bca503bea5ad4a6

commit_message:
Publicize oslo_policy.opts.register

Some projects (e.g., Glance) do not use global Enforcer instances and so
would need to register options at least once before the first Enforcer
instance is created. By providing a public register function (like other
oslo and openstack libraries do), we ensure that all uses of oslo.policy
can register options at the appropriate time.

Closes-bug: 1430508
Change-Id: Ib1bb95c7d339e707623ee8a103ea1fcea9c801d5

commit_message:
Fix available.html.example in transfer-table directory

Our real life use case of transfer-table (Launch Instance > Select Flavor)
does not use the warningText filter to display quota error messages.
See: https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard
/static/dashboard/launch-instance/flavor/select-flavor-table.html#L64

This otherwise unused filter is removed in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191200/

Change-Id: I09709aeb00f093495d2b17f9b9f12b731ed8e415
Closes-Bug: #1465378

commit_message:
Sent in the topic when taskmanager setup

The old setup won't sent the topic in, then we can not
change the taskmanager_queue as we want. So add it.

Change-Id: Ib457e49c5e58df711a8b963689db4c053ed9d201
Closes-bug: #1462734

commit_message:
Create new stackforge project for Cathead

Cathead is a TLS certificate monitoring service that can work in
conjunction with Anchor and other CAs to retrieve and update
certificates.

Change-Id: I3ff10ab1701a376a5d42e00ea853338777f8b5d7

commit_message:
Do not update the average when iteration failed

Total duration and iteration count are not updated on failed iterations
but new average was still calculated. When the failed iteration was the
first one, this resulted to zero division error.

Use latest average instead of calculating a new one in case of
failed iteration.

Change-Id: I3465a5e3de7b5838941d8ed044bb8865c69aa852
Closes-bug: #1464135

commit_message:
ofagent: Fix port_dead

Remove relevant flows on port_dead, so that it correctly
stops forwarding packets to/from admin_state_up=False ports.

Revealed by tempest test_update_instance_port_admin_state test case.

While i'm here, update docstring of port_dead.

(cherry-picked from networking-ofagent 92c9f3339811f332c89fc6e739f13a1a8fe733d1)
Closes-Bug: #1421098
Change-Id: I70ac46f77ed3f9fcfdb051abb4a5f09b81fb61b8

subject: Remove doc repositories from projects.txt
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 12:41:23.000000000', 'files': ['projects.txt'], 'message': "Remove doc repositories from projects.txt

The documentation repositories maintained by the OpenStack
Documentation team are currently all in projects.txt. They
are not installed together OpenStack server projects.

While the syncing of requirements is nice, it's not essential that
Documentation repo are part of requirements. The Documentation
repos have additional unique dependencies that are not needed by
other projects.

Still, the Documentation team likes to ensure that their requirements
are not conflicting with global requirements to allow editors and
developers reuse environments.

As discussed with Documentation team, remove these repositories
now (see thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2015-April/006362.html).

Change-Id: I807b061cf697dc79b26ffdfbe023c32600ddd346
(cherry picked from commit 8c9cd8c29bb146ca013efae0c726350889d1cc64)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove doc repositories from projects.txt

The documentation repositories maintained by the OpenStack
Documentation team are currently all in projects.txt. They
are not installed together OpenStack server projects.

While the syncing of requirements is nice, it's not essential that
Documentation repo are part of requirements. The Documentation
repos have additional unique dependencies that are not needed by
other projects.

Still, the Documentation team likes to ensure that their requirements
are not conflicting with global requirements to allow editors and
developers reuse environments.

As discussed with Documentation team, remove these repositories
now (see thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2015-April/006362.html).

Change-Id: I807b061cf697dc79b26ffdfbe023c32600ddd346
(cherry picked from commit 8c9cd8c29bb146ca013efae0c726350889d1cc64)

commit_message:
Fix http 500 when no accept header passed to secret GET /payload

Update secrets controller to catch the situation where no Accept
http header value is passed (or a blank value is passed).

Default to application/octet-stream as the Accept: header is not
required.

Change-Id: Icb940df639fb98ee594e3a2b227ed3f753d28517
Closes-Bug: 1462681

subject: enhancement for the common policy enforce
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 668, 'name': 'Adrian Otto', 'email': 'aotto@aotto.com', 'username': 'aotto'}, {'_account_id': 8143, 'name': 'Egor Guz', 'email': 'egor.guz@gmail.com', 'username': 'eghobo'}, {'_account_id': 11189, 'name': 'yuntongjin', 'email': 'yuntong.jin@intel.com', 'username': 'yuntong'}, {'_account_id': 11208, 'name': 'Baohua Yang', 'email': 'baohua@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'yangbaohua'}, {'_account_id': 11536, 'name': 'hongbin', 'email': 'hongbin034@gmail.com', 'username': 'hongbin'}, {'_account_id': 11650, 'name': 'Tom Cammann', 'email': 'tom.cammann@hpe.com', 'username': 'cammann'}, {'_account_id': 12927, 'name': 'Lan Qi song', 'email': 'lqs933@foxmail.com', 'username': 'lqisong'}, {'_account_id': 14131, 'name': 'shaohef', 'email': 'shaohe.feng@intel.com', 'username': 'shaohefeng'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-10 12:08:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'enhancement for the common policy enforce

Now the magnum.common.policy just support an "enforce" method to
wsgi policy check.

And this "enforce" method should be inline the body of wsgi method.
Such as:
from magnum.common import policy
class BaysController(rest.RestController):
    ....
    @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(None, types.uuid_or_name, status_code=204)
    def delete(self, bay_ident):
        ... doc string ...
        policy.enforce(pecan.request.context, "bay:create")
        .... common stuff ....

This inline style is ugly.

Now this patch is improving it.
This patch uses a decorator for policy check.
With this decorator we can do the policy check as follow:
from magnum.common import policy
class BaysController(rest.RestController):
    ....
    @policy.enforce_wsgi("bay", "delete")
    @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(None, types.uuid_or_name, status_code=204)
    def delete(self, bay_ident):
        ...

Here: This decorator MUST appear first (the outermost decorator) on an API
method for it to work correctly.

The decorator use functools.wraps to decorator the wsgi function.
A common decorator(without functools.wraps) replaces the original function
with an new one, that means it will lose the information about the original
function, it would be a serious problem for pcen wsgi.
That's why we have functools.wraps. This takes a function used in a decorator
and adds the functionality of copying over the function name, docstring,
arguments list, etc.

ref: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/308999/what-does-functools-wraps-do

Co-Authored-By: ShaoHe Feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com>
Change-Id: I9a7baf9559ff924ca4e261db2961b9d3c8763325
Partial-implements: blueprint policy-enfore

ref: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/308999/what-does-functools-wraps-do

Co-Authored-By: yuntongjin <yuntong.jin@intel.com>
Change-Id: I9a7baf9559ff924ca4e261db2961b9d3c8763325
Partial-implements: blueprint policy-enforce
', 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
enhancement for the common policy enforce

Now the magnum.common.policy just support an "enforce" method to
wsgi policy check.

And this "enforce" method should be inline the body of wsgi method.
Such as:
from magnum.common import policy
class BaysController(rest.RestController):
    ....
    @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(None, types.uuid_or_name, status_code=204)
    def delete(self, bay_ident):
        ... doc string ...
        policy.enforce(pecan.request.context, "bay:create")
        .... common stuff ....

This inline style is ugly.

Now this patch is improving it.
This patch uses a decorator for policy check.
With this decorator we can do the policy check as follow:
from magnum.common import policy
class BaysController(rest.RestController):
    ....
    @policy.enforce_wsgi("bay", "delete")
    @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(None, types.uuid_or_name, status_code=204)
    def delete(self, bay_ident):
        ...

Here: This decorator MUST appear first (the outermost decorator) on an API
method for it to work correctly.

The decorator use functools.wraps to decorator the wsgi function.
A common decorator(without functools.wraps) replaces the original function
with an new one, that means it will lose the information about the original
function, it would be a serious problem for pcen wsgi.
That's why we have functools.wraps. This takes a function used in a decorator
and adds the functionality of copying over the function name, docstring,
arguments list, etc.

ref: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/308999/what-does-functools-wraps-do

Co-Authored-By: yuntongjin <yuntong.jin@intel.com>
Change-Id: I9a7baf9559ff924ca4e261db2961b9d3c8763325
Partial-implements: blueprint policy-enforce

commit_message:
Allow to run patching on pre-defined tests

- Add variable to settings.py to specify particular test
to run patching on
- Modify map_tests() function to set as patching dependent test
that was exported

Change-Id: I2fd5e74343f334d59f341aa3f0700134cd902de4
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests

commit_message:
Add a route table manager

This class manages the /etc/iproute2/rt_tables file to assign each
scope id a unique routing table.  It uses a namespace specific table
so that the table in the root namespace remains untouched.

Change-Id: Ibdbaff4717d04948a11afadb421e625de072888a
Partially-implements:  blueprint address-scopes

Adds instructions to configure Horizon with HTTPS

* Key and certificate creation (with some recommendations)
* Apache configuration
* HAproxy configuration

commit_message:
Support recommendations in CDH plugin

We should support autoconfigurable hadoop configs in CDH plugin.
This patch does this job.

Implements bluprint: recommend-configuration

Change-Id: I3d938236786aae8f5e923a3fc3ef35ba24630e74

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-05 16:32:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Introduced "naming conventions" SA feature

In the current state some constraints has no defined names in the
project.

So they are generated by DB engine automatically and each DB generates
constraint names in its own fashion. This makes difficult to operate
with constraints, for example in migrations, where they should be
referred by names.

SQLAlchemy provides the feature for generation of constraint names
using patterns [1].

Leveraging it will bring consistency to constraints naming
in the project.

***IMPORTANT***

This revision also drops old migrations and starts migration from
scratch. It causes backward-incompatibility with previous versions.

Also SQLite support is dropped, migrations are no longer compatible with
this engine. It is no logner recommended to use it even for development.
However those who still wants to use SQLite can use introduced commands
"register_models" and "unregister_models". The first one generates
"CREATE TABLE" statements and syncs DB with models in one pass. The
second one does opposite.

[1] http://alembic.readthedocs.org/en/latest/naming.html#tutorial-constraint-names

Change-Id: Ie55843347c8bf0cbec162b1cfd2bad4d5fac1234
Related-Bug: #1399151

commit_message:
Introduced "naming conventions" SA feature

In the current state some constraints has no defined names in the
project.

So they are generated by DB engine automatically and each DB generates
constraint names in its own fashion. This makes difficult to operate
with constraints, for example in migrations, where they should be
referred by names.

SQLAlchemy provides the feature for generation of constraint names
using patterns [1].

Leveraging it will bring consistency to constraints naming
in the project.

***IMPORTANT***

This revision also drops old migrations and starts migration from
scratch. It causes backward-incompatibility with previous versions.

Also SQLite support is dropped, migrations are no longer compatible with
this engine. It is no longer recommended to use it even for development.
However those who still wants to use SQLite can use introduced commands
"register_models" and "unregister_models". The first one generates
"CREATE TABLE" statements and syncs DB with models in one pass. The
second one does opposite.

[1] http://alembic.readthedocs.org/en/latest/naming.html#tutorial-constraint-names

Change-Id: Ie55843347c8bf0cbec162b1cfd2bad4d5fac1234
Related-Bug: #1399151

commit_message:
Fix Create User form's fields sorting for Django 1.7

Starting from Django 1.7 self.fields.keyOrder no longer works for
setting fields ordering, need to rearrange fields there by recreating
underlying OrderedDict.

Change-Id: If0f4c7014a7a68f2ff0d0f2cb06f7b1c2e28436b
Closes-Bug: #1465221

commit_message:
Drop OVS & LB monolitic plugins

OVS & LB monolitic plugins have been dropped from Neutron in Juno and
have been replaced in Havana by ML2 (in neutron::plugins::ml2::X and
neutron::agents::ml2::X).
It's time to clean this module by dropping useless plugins.

Change-Id: I62ecd46fbc74f3e30b66052a7f95ee7c96c3138f

commit_message:
Move swift_allow_all_users to role defaults

We currently default swift_allow_all_users in
etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml instead of
playbooks/roles/os_swift/defaults/main.yml.  If a deployer removes this
variable from etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml, the swift
playbook will fail.  This commit moves the variable default to
playbooks/roles/os_swift/defaults/main.yml.

Change-Id: I9a73eda990327bf427f40a13965484fde00cbe21
Closes-Bug: #1424981
(cherry picked from commit 495f8b31d6400b50d0c64bba7ede7cbc4b181d23)

commit_message:
Block deploy/provision action for unassigned nodes

If user will try to provision or deploy node that is not
assigned to any environment, error will be printed.
Also removed required "env" param for deploy/provision
action since it's not used there.

Change-Id: I3787c50cb5284b43cbb44261da000baf040cc684
Closes-Bug: #1445531

subject: Amend resource objects proposal
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-05 12:32:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Amend resource objects proposal

Jay drew a hard line between amounts and usages, whereas I think those
are the same. I draw the hard line between amounts and requests.

I also want to be able to deal with resources which are not easily
dealt with as independent integer resources.

Work in progress!

commit_message:
Amend resource objects proposal

We agreed that Usage wasn't the most useful term. Rewrite in terms of
Inventories.

Get rid of the conductor RPC method - we'll just use ComputeNode#save.

Fix some minor nits.

Change-Id: Idceba6dd53e4c4827e37f9e01b34a89455783d39

Update usage documentation

This updates the usage document to clarify the helper functions
used to create cloud connections, and also adds documentation to
those functions.

commit_message:
Replace dict(obj.iteritems() with dict(obj)

Since oslo.db 1.10, it's possible to convert directly a SQLAlchemy
object to a dictionary using dict(obj) instead of having to write
dict(obj.iteritems()).

dict(obj) works also on regular dictionaries to duplicate a dictionary.

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I868a055d5bbfe6646aad3e36e1bf6c7a1ad7b449

filters param in cinder.scheduler.

commit_message:
Set MURANO_REPOSITORY_URL for client tests

Since murano-ci job is checked for every commit to python-muranoclient
and this include testing repository functionality, MURANO_REPOSITORY_URL
has to be set for such tests. This change should unblock client gate.

Change-Id: I923fdb4792fa3253e108e781bba2776b88aa902f
Closes-Bug: #1465632

commit_message:
Path to mysql-wss script in DB backup/restore doc

In the Fuel 6.1 Operations Guide, path to mysql-wss is incorrect in
db-backup-ops.rst file.

It is now /usr/lib/ocf/resource.d/fuel/mysql-wss, not
/usr/lib/ocf/resource.d/mirantis/mysql-wss.

Change-Id: I0aa561a9803493da45e0b023b5623f540e03de08
Closes-bug: 1464755

commit_message:
Connect RPM repo to master during patching env

In order to deliver patches for puppet manifests
on OpenStack environments, tests should be able to
update 'fuel-library' package on master node (during
tests for environment patching). Add additional
setting for specifying custom repositories which must be
connected to master node.

Change-Id: I4f68e31ebba67b87652aed15fc894b006e603c81
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests

commit_message:
Don't check updates on all slaves by default

By default tests shouldn't check packages updates are
available on all slave nodes and update those packages.
In necessary these actions should be described in
erratum for bug.

Change-Id: I01ea561166b98fb70bfe7123e8d09d8630ac0e87
Closes-bug: #1465563

commit_message:
Don't check updates on all slaves by default

By default tests shouldn't check packages updates are
available on all slave nodes and update those packages.
In necessary these actions should be described in
erratum for bug.

Change-Id: I01ea561166b98fb70bfe7123e8d09d8630ac0e87
Closes-bug: #1465563

commit_message:
Connect RPM repo to master during patching env

In order to deliver patches for puppet manifests
on OpenStack environments, tests should be able to
update 'fuel-library' package on master node (during
tests for environment patching). Add additional
setting for specifying custom repositories which must be
connected to master node.

Change-Id: I4f68e31ebba67b87652aed15fc894b006e603c81
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests

to pypi while this is ongoing in order to unblock CI.

commit_message:
Addresses UcsSdk install issue

UcsSdk install issue with pip. New version of UcsSdk, 0.8.1.9 will be
used.

commit_message:
Implement private share_types

Add share_type_access extension which introduces
the ability to manage share type access:
* Share types are public by default
* Private share types can be created by setting
  the is_public boolean field to False at creation time.
* Access to a private share type can be controlled
  by adding or removing a project from it.
* Private share types without projects are only visible
  by users with the admin role/context.
Implementation details and unit tests were mostly adapted
from Cinder and Nova access extensions.

Implements bp private-share-types

Change-Id: I83ee57c6a516b5382d074c0082525ad7feadd59c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 16687, 'name': 'Shu Shen', 'email': 'shu.shen@gmail.com', 'username': 'shushen'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-10 07:07:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Configurable lxc cache and rootfs path

The rootfs of the containers uses large disk spaces and is defaulted to
/var/lib/lxc. It's desirable to configure an alternative rootfs directory on a
partition with large enough disk space to hold the rootfs.

The rootfs of a container is hard-linked to the lxc cache when created by lxc
templates. Therefore they have to reside on the same partition and the lxc
cache shall be configurable as well as the rootfs directory.

The lxc-ubuntu template is patched by lxc-host role to use the configured lxc
cache folder.

To confgiure these parameters, set the following variables in global_overrides
of openstack_user_config.yml:
    - lxc_container_directory, defaults to /var/lib/lxc
    - lxc_container_cache_path, defaults to /var/cache/lxc

Change-Id: I9ccf0c45e0a1875644750e0d70ce613265040176
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-10 16:49:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Configurable lxc cache and rootfs path
