commit_message:
Configurable lxc cache and rootfs path

The rootfs of the containers use large disk space and is defaulted to
/var/lib/lxc. It's desirable to configure an alternative rootfs directory on a
partition with large enough free space to hold the rootfs.

The rootfs of a container is hard-linked to the lxc cache when created by lxc
templates. Therefore both have to reside on the same partition and the lxc
cache shall be configurable as well as the rootfs directory.

The lxc-ubuntu template is patched by lxc-host role to use the configured lxc
cache folder. This patch should be removed once the updated upstream lxc with
support of configuring the cache path goes mainstream.

To confgiure these parameters, set the following variables in global_overrides
of openstack_user_config.yml:
    - lxc_container_directory, defaults to /var/lib/lxc
    - lxc_container_cache_path, defaults to /var/cache/lxc

Closes-Bug: #1463905
Change-Id: I9ccf0c45e0a1875644750e0d70ce613265040176

commit_message:
Set default pass in aio scripts to be random

In the bootstrap-aio.sh and osad-aio-heat-template.yml we use a default
password of "secrete". As a minor security concern, this patch adjusts
this to be random.

Change-Id: I54b9a085aba7845b7a9ad435c60604359921fc09
Closes-Bug: #1462000

commit_message:
Switch put_update to patch_update

As PUT updates are the great majority, and PATCH is only used in a
handful of places, swap out this name and the behavior so that PUT is
the default. Identity v3 and one resource in Image v2 use PATCH for
their updates, so they enable it.

Change-Id: I3f7ed19f050a0c6477f1b91112ff2dc4e1fc2528
Closes-Bug: 1427479

There is no need for a "Indices and tables" slide. The slide is
confusing and should be removed.

* convert the index.rst file from a default Sphinx documentation
  index.rst file into a more useful hieroglyph index.rst file

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "change the default to PyMYSQL""

Some projects (Neutron) seem to be affected more than others, so we should revert this
to allow for a more selective choice of the DB driver on a per project basis.

We can re-enable the use MySQL-python just for Neutron.

This reverts commit de8d29ed8ce4a26b61cbee48f9fe5418d5416a06.

Related-Bug: #1464612

Change-Id: I889f4f8b116c413b300ab9eecc7b428a9a4afb1a

commit_message:
Add required devel packages for python-qpid-proton

python-qpid-proton does something similar to pyzmq when libzmq is not
installed. It bundles the underlying library and builds it.
Unfortunately, python-qpid-proton currently has a dependency on
`uuid-dev` and `swig` to build the python module.

These dependencies are being relaxed but it won't be until the next
release that we'll be able to live without them. Until then, I'm adding
these packages to the list of required packages.

Change-Id: Icb22b710d2a7eeaed6d8fa55a389077204d1f8d9

commit_message:
Providers should use auth_uri if available

The old auth_host/auth_port/auth_protocol parameters are deprecated in
the manifests, but the provider code hasn't been updated to allow
getting rid of them.  This changes the providers to use auth_uri if
available and fallback to using the old parameters if auth_uri isn't
available.

Change-Id: I5ae48f9cdeca656d1d8344a004cdc30202dffb6d

commit_message:
Release Notes 6.1 -- New Features (Fuel)

This commit provides RN for the following
features:

- granular task-based deployment
- rendering graph
- network verification before deployment
- remove node from inventory
- role operations

Change-Id: I5bca9c6c2982c2d9c571e438658e9bfece03dabd
Implements: blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks
Related-Bug: 1415520
Implements: blueprint remove-node-from-fuel-inventory

commit_message:
Allow protocol to be set per endpoint-type

If services are running behind an SSL terminating LB you will want to
differentiate between protocol on internalURL and publicURL endpoints.
This patch allows you to set the values of protocol per endpoint type,
but doesn't change the default behaviour which is to have it set in one
var.

Change-Id: I7a74c85a8841499623746586ae27103a71c6fec0
Partial-Bug: #1399383

commit_message:
Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items()

This change adds Python 3 compatibility to the modified code.

Replace also six.iteritems(obj) with obj.items().

The iteritems() method of Python 2 dictionaries was renamed to items()
on Python 3. As discussed on the openstack-dev mailing list, iteritems()
must be replaced with items(), six.iteritems() should not be used. In
OpenStack, the overhead of creating a temporary list with dict.items()
on Python 2 is negligible.

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: Ic3d8fd6b71d2c9f21929b0d6bf68c8f84a5e2567

commit_message:
Allow to run patching on pre-defined tests

- Add variable to settings.py to specify particular test
to run patching on
- Modify map_tests() function to set as patching dependent test
that was exported

Change-Id: I2fd5e74343f334d59f341aa3f0700134cd902de4
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests

commit_message:
Release Notes 6.1 - New Features (Partner)

This commit contains the following new partner features:

* dual hypervisor support
* multiple cinder types support
* VMware Settings tab on the Fuel web UI
* Mellanox Infiniband

Change-Id: I27250ccfe3fb5ae719151e3b104dc74e5128301e
Implements: blueprint vmware-dual-hypervisor
Implements: blueprint cinder-vmdk-role
Implements: blueprint vmware-ui-settings

This commit introduces support for multiple positional arguments in

commit_message:
Support multiple filenames for package commands

Before only a single package/bundle could be imported and deleted at a time.
This commit introduces support for multiple positional arguments in
bundle-import and package-import and package-delete commands.

Package and bundle dependencies are tracked in a single
dictionary during import. This means, that importing 2 packages,
that have common dependency-package would cause that package
to be imported only once.

Since it is highly complicated to specify --version for multiple
positional arguments with argparse this option is ignored, when used
with multiple packages.

Closes-Bug: #1441204
Partially-implements: blueprint multiple-positional-arguments
Change-Id: Id06c642d88f7d2a2726aec56e753c8db7dcc8ceb

commit_message:
[Manila] Add context for Manila quotas

Add context for following Manila quotas:
- shares
- gigabytes
- snapshots
- snapshot_gigabytes
- share_networks

And set default values as unlimited (-1).

Change-Id: Ie92f9ba03b5229984ee8b148d4bef715693c31e7

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for quota_get_all_*

This patch removes the hard-code permission checks for db call
quota_get_all_*

For v2 API, there is same project owner hard-code permission checks
at REST API layer, so nothing we need to for it.

For v2.1, adds the 'target' for policy enforcement that used to
enforce owner checks. The default method use same rule with show
method before. After removed hard-code permission checks for show
method, this patch adds new rule for distinguish different permission
of defaults and show.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

UpgradeImpact: Due to the db layer permission checks was deleted. The
default rule is added to "os_compute_api:os-quota-sets:show" for
matching the same permission as before. Show and default action are
shared same rule before. But after the cleanup, those two methods have
different permission. So add new rule for default action
"os_compute_api:os-quota-sets:defaults".

Change-Id: I63f180770a9199046452be7ad6e031a142d3c79d

commit_message:
Introduce gnocchi-metricd

This daemon is responsible for treating new measures that are sent to
storage drivers and must be run in background.

Also add a thread in the gabbi ConfigFixture to do metricd
processing. Without this the new async processing of measures will
cause tests that check to see if measures were created will fail.
Meanwhile gabbi >=0.100.0 provides a 'poll' function so that tests
will try a few times for what they are looking for.

The tests in resource.yaml have been cleaned up to insure that they
are testing a specific resource and its measures, not an ambiguous
last-in-the-list member of resources. async.yaml confirms the async
handling.

The 'file' storage driver has been adjusted to make sure that writes
of aggregation files are atomic (by writing to a tmp file that is
renamed. Without this it is possible for files to exist but be read
as being empty.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <chdent@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0fd449ee82073edafca7673d00c69e61f75bb7d0

commit_message:
Add blueprint for tempest cli improvements

Added WIP branch to use for cli design discussion.
Please see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148611/
Checkout that commit and install tempest using
setup tools. From there use help system for proposed
CLI UX.
Change-Id: I12741da8b380597a0a33e4f1c5e5a6610edf50f1
bp:tempest-cli-improvements

commit_message:
Replace it.next() with next(it) for py3 compat

The Python 2 next() method of iterators was renamed to __next__() on
Python 3. Use the builtin next() function instead which works on Python
2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: Ic948bc574b58f1d28c5c58e3985906dee17fa51d

subject: Improve _find_network_host function in nmanager
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-16 09:56:45.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/nmanager.py'], 'message': 'Improve _find_network_host function in nmanager

VMware integration assumes using fake host parameter. For this reason
when we launch test "Check network connectivity from instance" ostf
has to use special function _find_network_host which return real
hostname where nova-network runs.

This function uses command 'pcs status' for requests pacemaker/corosync
system. When some nodes of corosync cluster fails this command works
really slow and test can't meet the timeout.

This patch-set changes slow 'pcs status' to 'crm_mon -1' which realizes
same behavior but faster.

Change-Id: I80e645ec9da5f4421182bef10f368a3e5c73258d
Closes-bug: #1465268
(cherry picked from commit 573eac27e4f5a7765a65ae3afa862f52bf867a4e)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Improve _find_network_host function in nmanager

VMware integration assumes using fake host parameter. For this reason
when we launch test "Check network connectivity from instance" ostf
has to use special function _find_network_host which return real
hostname where nova-network runs.

This function uses command 'pcs status' for requests pacemaker/corosync
system. When some nodes of corosync cluster fails this command works
really slow and test can't meet the timeout.

This patch-set changes slow 'pcs status' to 'crm_mon -1' which realizes
same behavior but faster.

Change-Id: I80e645ec9da5f4421182bef10f368a3e5c73258d
Closes-bug: #1465268
(cherry picked from commit 573eac27e4f5a7765a65ae3afa862f52bf867a4e)

commit_message:
Improve _find_network_host function in nmanager

VMware integration assumes using fake host parameter. For this reason
when we launch test "Check network connectivity from instance" ostf
has to use special function _find_network_host which return real
hostname where nova-network runs.

This function uses command 'pcs status' for requests pacemaker/corosync
system. When some nodes of corosync cluster fails this command works
really slow and test can't meet the timeout.

This patch-set changes slow 'pcs status' to 'crm_mon -1' which realizes
same behavior but faster.

Change-Id: I80e645ec9da5f4421182bef10f368a3e5c73258d
Closes-bug: #1465268

commit_message:
Remove predecessor column from raw_template.

This column is never used. The logic to retrieve the previous template
for rollback is based on stack table's prev_template_id.

Change-Id: Ib0af21502d0cc94613b3963d6ccdeffbc8103f6b

commit_message:
Use `inferred=True` by default

Rabbitmq's amqp1.0 plugin doesn't have support for vbin8, which is the
default encoding used by qpid-proton. In order to workaround this issue
we should use inferred=True.

Closes-bug: #1465409
Change-Id: Id265917244d7e152c5e13a10df367a3e59de8e50

commit_message:
Set permissions on user_secrets.yml to 0600

The permissions on the user_secrets file are too open, adjust this so that
after using pw-token-gen.py it sets the file to be 0600 for
user_secrets.yml and the backup tar file that is created. Additionally,
add a note in the README to recommend adjusting the permissions when not
utilising the pw-token-gen.py

Change-Id: I90ffacd83a89a92f48cf160e5b351e1254e9c73a
Closes-Bug: #1461997
(cherry picked from commit 3f8905caee8a0ec1afe90ba6df9b91aca14c67ec)

subject: Enable amqp's protocol unit tests everywhere

commit_message:
Enable amqp's protocol unit tests everywhere

Now that python-qpid-proton has taken an approach similar to zmq's, it's
possible to install it in boxes where the C libraries are not present in
the system. This patch takes advantage of that to enable amqp protocol's
tests everywhere.

Change-Id: Ibce4c791aafadf45fa876d6a4f5373fde94769ff

commit_message:
Don't raise exception from set_failed_state()

deploy_utils.set_failed_state() shouldn't raise any exceptions because
it is used to handle a failed deployment, and we want the node's
last_error to be set.

Instead, in the very rare (if ever) case that the call to
task.process_event() fails, we'll log an exception and continue.

Change-Id: I8f02577de5a5bce34608882f61b5b26f5b998fad
Closes-Bug: #1461670

commit_message:
Separate quota_classes client from quotas client

Each resource should be implemented in each separated module.
quota_classes and quotas are different resources like
  os-quota-class-sets
  os-quota-sets
So this patch separates quota_classes client from quotas client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Icd98294c7a161f5c8c1d7202df9f3e6d9daee1d9

commit_message:
Fix fuel_syntax_check.sh for Mac OS X

The find command in OS X requires a path be specified or it will print
an error message. This change adds '.' to the command so that it will
properly run under Mac OS X. Additionally this change adds some error
messgaging to help identify where failures might occur.

Change-Id: Ib4dafcd5ab5b98b9602cc2f1ae44550b5b780556
Closes-Bug: 1454277

commit_message:
Dynamic pipeline configuration using file reloading

By enhancing Ceilometer to monitor pipeline file
configuration, Ceilometer can be made to dynamically
activate/deactivate meters, collection targets or similar
functions, have distinctly different configurations for
multiple nodes in different environments and can be
updated with new collection targets “on-the-fly”.

blueprint reload-file-based-pipeline-configuration
Change-Id: I326fb42be1fe0fd61626dcc6a866569639f58f35

commit_message:
Changing default value of description from None to empty string

When the user is creating/updating a security group if he 
doesn't give a value for the description field nova uses 
None as the default value for the field. This cannot be 
parsed by the neutron client and it throws an neutron 
exception. So changing the value from None to empty string as 
neutron accepts a empty string in the description field

Change-Id: If5139b1a7f8aac534bd3ed13fc35994f68a4674d
Closes-Bug: #1460875

commit_message:
Python 3: use dict.values instead of dict.itervalues

This works with both Python 2 and 3, and should not have any performance
impact.

Change-Id: I2a14945c60de513b91c6f022ff5dcc503ce2a8ad
Blueprint: neutron-python3

commit_message:
devstack: do not run update-db on a compute node

When the devstack plugin is run, but q-scv is not
enabled (like on a compute node), we should not
run xxx-db-manage.

Change-Id: I6551da1020758132fd747ef119d33c3c4cb270f7

commit_message:
Split environment file into component parts

This patch splits the monolithic openstack_environment file
into component parts, making them easier to understand and
manipulate.

Change-Id: I45887599bd887a272798047f9ad650d4811ab380
Closes-Bug: #1463862

commit_message:
Merge tag '2015.1.0'

This is a null-merge of the 2015.1.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 2015.1.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: I13616ea7dd533242c12b9bf4a8af9f45c3d1afa3

commit_message:
Add get_events to OVSDB monitor

OVSDB monitor can generate the events that the OVS agent
needs to process (device added or updated). Instead of
notifying only that a change occurred and that polling
is needed, pass the events to the agent

Change-Id: I3d17bf995ad4508c4c6d089de550148da1465fa1
Partially-Implements: blueprint restructure-l2-agent

commit_message:
Wait until service thread is done on service stop

In order to be able to perform graceful shutdown of services, we need
to wait for all the current service threads to finish before exiting
from the service process.

Oslo.service provides this facility through it's wait() method, so we
need to call it in Cinder Service stop() method which gets called when
graceful shutdown is requested by sending the process SIGINT or SIGTERM.

Partial-Bug: 1464822
Change-Id: I972b80251cebe353f9d89ff4e05db8d029ef5e73

subject: Configure DB addresses for each service
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-10 17:27:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Configure DB addresses for each service

To enable partitioning of DB traffic by-service, each service needs to
use a custom connection string. Defaulting the service address to a
common galera_address makes things continue to work by default.

While the galera_address could be overridden on a container or host
basis this requires repeating that behavior across each infra node in
the inventory. Providing service-specific connection address variables
simplifies the management somewhat for large deployments and may reduce
error rates.

The service install playbooks now default the service-specific variables
instead of galera_address to the internal lb vip from inventory to
maintain the ease-of-use currently available.

Any value for a service-specific variable set in user_variables.yml will
override the value in the playbook's vars to provide selective
customization as needed.

Change-Id: I4c98bf906a0c1cb11ddd41277a855dce22ff646a
Closes-Bug: 1462529

commit_message:
Configure DB addresses for each service

To enable partitioning of DB traffic by-service, each service needs to
use a custom connection string. Defaulting the service address to a
common galera_address makes things continue to work by default.

While the galera_address could be overridden on a container or host
basis this requires repeating that behavior across each infra node in
the inventory. Providing service-specific connection address variables
simplifies the management somewhat for large deployments and may reduce
error rates.

The service install playbooks now default the service-specific variables
instead of galera_address to the internal lb vip from inventory to
maintain the ease-of-use currently available.

Any value for a service-specific variable set in user_variables.yml will
override the value in the playbook's vars to provide selective
customization as needed.

Change-Id: I4c98bf906a0c1cb11ddd41277a855dce22ff646a
Closes-Bug: 1462529
(cherry picked from commit 3d1b45ea4cfa31c27d43d9cec2a1b1f7746e8fa8)

commit_message:
Updates the container build process

The container build process needs to make sure that the service
sources are correctly setup and updated prior to running any other
playbooks.

The modification here is nessisary to break out the process for the
proxy create, apt sources deployment, the update of those sources
and keys, container upgrades and the installation of python2.7 for
use with Ansible. This also allows for better debugging of a failure
in container create as we'll now be able to tell where in the process
a failure happens and be able to use tags to resolve it.

Change-Id: I36be437303a73bbc98a1cd5297f6c65591653cd7
Closes-Bug: 1464771

commit_message:
Updates the container build process

The container build process needs to make sure that the service
sources are correctly setup and updated prior to running any other
playbooks.

The modification here is nessisary to break out the process for the
proxy create, apt sources deployment, the update of those sources
and keys, container upgrades and the installation of python2.7 for
use with Ansible. This also allows for better debugging of a failure
in container create as we'll now be able to tell where in the process
a failure happens and be able to use tags to resolve it.

Change-Id: I36be437303a73bbc98a1cd5297f6c65591653cd7
Closes-Bug: 1464771
(cherry picked from commit 86b6e8e6409f76c46551becdac783a76bb853980)

commit_message:
Prevent agent hangs if ohai does not return disks

Instead of freeze we got all data without disks now.
Current timeout - 30 sec.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Scherbakov (mihgen) <mscherbakov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I65d1b570cd01e12b521403c6d6e990043eb2c2ab

commit_message:
Revert "Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL"

The failure rate with neutron is too high to keep this
as the default.

Related-Bug: #1464612

This reverts commit f08e9f1f53efa97e07f21ca72a940fcbeb4570e5.

Change-Id: If6d08e9f216ca90df882de8f27f9103fa4889c98

subject: Sort instances if possible inside an host aggregate
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-13 16:58:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Sort instances if possible inside an host aggregate

Simple use case: Reduce the licence cost
Windows licences are billed by host or by socket. The goal is to stack all
Windows instances on the same hosts as much as possible without creating a
new host aggregate.

As much as possible means this is a best effort feature, if nova can place
this new Windows instance on a compute where other Windows are running, do
it. If not, spawn it where you want or on a empty compute to identify it
as « preferred widows compute » for future windows spawn.

This use case could be extended to many other situations, every time you
have a preferred situation with no hard restrictions.

Change-Id: I261bcb802573406f0aca5a87606e4dcca877301b

commit_message:
Sort instances if possible inside an host aggregate

Simple use case: Reduce the licence cost
Windows licences are billed by host or by socket. The goal is to stack all
Windows instances on the same hosts as much as possible without creating a
new host aggregate.

As much as possible means this is a best effort feature, if nova can place
this new Windows instance on a compute where other Windows are running, do
it. If not, spawn it where you want or on a empty compute to identify it
as « preferred widows compute » for future windows spawn.

This use case could be extended to many other situations, every time you
have a preferred situation with no hard restrictions.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: I261bcb802573406f0aca5a87606e4dcca877301b

commit_message:
External net should also be flat, unless segmentation_id is found

If we do not pass the network_type:flat param, the ext-net will
be created as a vlan when vlan is chosen as tenant network type,
because the single physical_network we have defined in neutron
(datacentre) is also the one used for tenant vlans.

Change-Id: Iabbcd2493a497a542514085eeb68ae653c0c77a6
Depends-On: Ieb1a9842410ecf4e89af075a4190c3a28036df9c

commit_message:
Add BondInterfaceOvsOptions parameter

This patch adds a new BondInterfaceOvsOptions to the
bond-with-vlans network config templates. This can
be used to configure things like LACP or the bonding mode
via a nested stack heat parameter.

The patch also removes the hard coded ovs_options relating
to both bond-with-vlans and single-nic-with-vlans configurations
which do not actually require this setting to be hard coded
because by default OVS trunks vlan ports automatically.

Change-Id: I3effbccba8ed7ed28d6ba715e5709275d4e7f984

commit_message:
network/config storage role fixes

None of the storage roles have Heat parameters for the bridge
name. Instead of wiring in Heat parameters for bridge name
this patch hard codes the bridge name for the storage roles
to 'br-storage'.

This functionally fixes the network config scripts for each
of the storage roles.

For the single-nic-vlans storage roles we also remove
the 'bond1' reference which was also incorrectly specified.

Change-Id: I460d1a17e44ee49e960117ec85edd3ae25894333

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-05 02:52:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add support for isolating swift storage nets

This patch updates the Puppet Swift storage role
so that it supports network isolation. By default
all traffic still flows on the ctlplane network
but if network isolation is enabled then network
traffic will flow over the configured storage_mgmt
network interface.

This patch also fixes a few critical issues with
the swift storage role that prevented it from
working:
 - oac_data for the swift devices was overriding the
   data provided in the swift_devices_and_proxy
   hieradata file.
 - the role was missing declarations to load hieradata
   files for swift_devices_and_proxy and all_nodes
 - The required snmpd settings were not getting set
   correctly in the 'object' hiera data file.

With all of these changes the Swift storage role
works correctly with and without network isolation.

Change-Id: I541abb2604380f603bba91ad88e54783ee450a8f

commit_message:
Add support for isolating swift storage nets

This patch updates the Puppet Swift storage role
so that it supports network isolation. By default
all traffic still flows on the ctlplane network
but if network isolation is enabled then network
traffic will flow over the configured storage_mgmt
network interface.

This patch also fixes a few critical issues with
the swift storage role that prevented it from
working:
 - oac_data for the swift devices was overriding the
   data provided in the swift_devices_and_proxy
   hieradata file.
 - the role was missing declarations to load hieradata
   files for swift_devices_and_proxy and all_nodes
 - The required snmpd settings were not getting set
   correctly in the 'object' hiera data file.

With all of these changes the Swift storage role
works correctly with and without network isolation.

Change-Id: I541abb2604380f603bba91ad88e54783ee450a8f

commit_message:
Remove external bridge from Compute nodes

This change modifies overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml to
use net-config-noop.yaml as the default os-net-config template
for compute nodes. The current default of net-config-bridge.yaml
will set up a br-ex on the compute nodes. Since we are not using
DVR that is not needed.

Change-Id: I4e149a4f5a6d19e94e8c0245f52677f92f22d3ec

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-10 11:35:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add sysfsutils package

  When we calling fuel-createmirror without arguments,
  it removes upstream ubuntu mirrors.
  Since there is no MOS packages that depends on sysfsutils,
  it not going to be installed on local repos.
  But sysfsutils is requested in 'osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig'
  module which generates error.
  We have to add this package to repo persistently.

Change-Id: I6ddfe50e0fb81584e9228d973a67be03c97f2564
Closes-Bug: #1462216

  This is due to the fact that no MOS packages are depend on
  'sysfsutils' and therefore it is not installed on local repos
  and the `fuel-createmirror' call without arguments removed
  upstream Ubuntu mirrors.

Change-Id: I6ddfe50e0fb81584e9228d973a67be03c97f2564
Closes-Bug: #1462216
", 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Add 'sysfsutils' package persistenlty

  The sysfsutils is required by 'osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig'
  module that generates the error pointed out by the bug: #1462216.
  This is due to the fact that no MOS packages are depend on
  'sysfsutils' and therefore it is not installed on local repos
  and the `fuel-createmirror' call without arguments removed
  upstream Ubuntu mirrors.

Change-Id: I6ddfe50e0fb81584e9228d973a67be03c97f2564
Closes-Bug: #1462216

commit_message:
Move create_ports to NodeInfo

Makes code more consistent and fixes bug with ironicclient error
reporting.

Also make NodeInfo.ports() return a dict to be more useful
for callers (like process.py).

Change-Id: I6ba587a31e839aba511c16fbf93047c7fdc54cc2
Closes-Bug: #1464184

commit_message:
Parameter can not be test in Huawei driver

In test_huawei_nas.py:
The 'Call' function of the parameters('data') can not be
test. Because of the variable('data') is assigned None in line 93.
So modify the variable name from 'data' to 'result'.

Change-Id: I8243ed3c59fbef76ebc1991286deb5c08fe813c3
Closes-Bug: #1465507

commit_message:
Provide hook into process when a node isn't found

Nodes that don't exist in the inspector node cache maybe still be
booted and return inspection information to process, this patch allows
an operator to hook into the point when the not found error is thrown
so that they may handle that information in anyway they decide to.

Change-Id: Ib17491a8201cf534d498c68d916b5b37b07f5ff6
Implements: blueprint node-not-found-hook

commit_message:
Add monotonic as a requirement.

This is needed so that oslo.incubator can use a monotonic timer for
loopingcall, instead of time.time().

Change-Id: Ia802cf5bc605aa428596731d86d995e75d4fdd59
Related-Bug: #1450438

commit_message:
Added correct URL to edit QoS spec

Not able to edit the QoS spec since we are getting 'NoReverseMatch' exception.

The Exception thrown because the given URL is not correct.

This patch adding the correct URL to edit the QoS spec.

Change-Id: I0381ea343494be3449a8036b99fcbba98d893cb9
Closes-Bug: #1465185

commit_message:
Adding django-babel plugin to Horizon

Dependency allow custom extracting of Django messages using Babel.
This plugin architecture allows for future extraction for AngularJS.

Change-Id: Iaa835b03af3929b7314b174210079c34de976755
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-translate-makemessages

commit_message:
Create a Heat-specific VIP for Pacemaker HA

This change modifies the parameters that determine which virtual IP
the Heat API uses. If there are no isolated networks, a virtual IP
on the 'ctlplane' network will be created. If the isolated network
referenced in ServiceNetMap for the Heat API exists, then a VIP
will be created on that network for Heat. For non-puppet deployments
the noop.yaml port will pass through the Controller ctlplane IP.

Change-Id: I4266aea3e0c60a12ecf24c6789c78b6f58b8300e

commit_message:
Remove VERBOSE global state.

Instead pass a verbose closure down, which while one more parameter
will prevent any skew in future unit tests.

Change-Id: I310a8fa185b2381a43b28c92ddc3f08e3c6ba035

commit_message:
Don't write partial requirements files.

If we detected nonstandard requirements we were previously rewriting
half the requirements file, making this non-idempotent: all the
subsequent contents was being lost.

Change-Id: If550d98fcab33a915bd44347bac1b538386d691f

which can be used by deploy drivers to set up
the node to boot.

commit_message:
Fix multipath device discovery when UFN is enabled.

This currently returns an invalid path of `/dev/mapper/${WWID}`
when UFN is enabled leading to failures later on when we attempt to
use the device.

The output of `multipath -l ${path}` or `multipath -l ${wwid}`
should always list the correct device identifier to use with this
path as the first word on the first line.

Ignoring the test_find_multipath_device_with_error test case since
the stable/juno code base does not check for error while fetching
the associated multipath device.

Conflicts:
	cinder/brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py
	cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_linuxscsi.py

Closes-Bug: 1401799

Change-Id: Ib371b699fadcbbbb666e08eb0124c442e94a55e8
(cherry picked from commit 2fe4de571e925e26c77bffbda908f16e375b8a83)

commit_message:
Replace it.next() with next(it) for py3 compat

The Python 2 next() method of iterators was renamed to __next__() on
Python 3. Use the builtin next() function instead which works on Python
2 and Python 3.
This patch was generated by the next operation of the sixer tool:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sixer

Change-Id: I13948f73f34c396c5cb4d55b636f12b96e62f9f9
Closes-Bug: #1464935

commit_message:
Add delete method for security group rules

Adds new API method for deleting a security group rule.

This conforms to the newly agreed upon pattern of returning True
if the resource was deleted, or False if it was not found and
could not be deleted.

Change-Id: I9c66aee078fa999a85336f600f086b93640ca96e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-13 23:56:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor find_nova_addresses()

Current implementation of find_nova_addresses() doesn't allow to search
just IPv4 or IPv6 addresses without specifying key_name or ext_tag too.
Moreover, when using key_name it doesn't take into account ext_tag.

This patch refactors find_nova_addresses to be more "intuitive" and to
allow searching just IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-14 17:13:25.000000000', 'files': ['shade/meta.py'], 'message': 'Refactor find_nova_addresses()

Current implementation of find_nova_addresses() doesn't allow to search
just IPv4 or IPv6 addresses without specifying key_name or ext_tag too.

commit_message:
Refactor find_nova_addresses()

Current implementation of find_nova_addresses() doesn't allow to search
just IPv4 or IPv6 addresses without specifying key_name or ext_tag too.
Moreover, when using key_name it doesn't take into account ext_tag.

This patch refactors find_nova_addresses to be more "intuitive" and to
allow searching just IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.

Change-Id: I58601a8a12ede4519869c6cf2206a934c38553f3

commit_message:
Replace get_server_public_ip() with get_server_external_ipv4()

get_server_public_ip() just returns floating IP addresses or addresses
from a network named 'public'.

get_server_external_ipv4() tries hard to find an IPv4 address reachable
from outside the cloud.

Change-Id: I8e2c856b8f913424d3c0f20b72f240e08e4b9f62

commit_message:
Forbid deleting cluster which has policy attached to

User is not allowed to delete a cluster which still has policy
being attached to. This patch added policy check in cluster_delete
method in engine service to implement this restriction.

Change-Id: Ic4b5db68ba3e82444b10a77431ca4dc80ed6b5bd

commit_message:
Correct resource name for consolidate console API

We already have API register sub-resource 'consoles' under resource servers,
it is xen specific API:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/consoles.py?id=2015.1.0#n122

This spec propose to register sub-resource 'console' under resource servers.
It really confusing we have two sub-resource, which one is 'consoles' and another
one is 'console', under resource servers.

And as the API-WG guideline
https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/naming.rst
The resource should be always represented as the plural. 'console' violate
that guideline.

Related to blueprint consolidate-console-api
APIImpact

Change-Id: I5fce244b4f301afcea1e2637d97982cc2bd95027

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Add storage QoS support

Hyper-V provides options to specify maximum IOPS per virtual disk
image.

By leveraging this feature, this blueprint proposes to add support
for setting QoS specs targeting instance local disks as well as
volumes exported through SMB.

bp hyperv-storage-qos

Change-Id: Icb2edcba52cb82078ee4d364422229e4e3f2fe1a

commit_message:
_validate_mac_address do not check if it's input is None

_validate_mac_address do not check if it's input is None, if None is
provided it will raise a TypeError which will confuse people to locate
the real problem.

Change-Id: I62444f02a6aa8baba30ae9071ee6f049d8350bd4
Closes-Bug: #1452804

commit_message:
Remove WritableLogger wrapper

With Eventlet 0.17.2, we can directly pass the logger
instance. This allows us to deprecate/remove the WritableLogger
class from oslo.log.

Change-Id: Ib7d193435584fc3631740058ed34b4df4ab23ad6
Closes-Bug: #1440773

In current version of nova, live-migration with config drive on
local disk is forbidden due to the bug of libvirt of copying readonly
disk. However, if we use vfat as the format of config drive,
the function of live-migration works well.

In this patch, we re-open the function of live-migration to admin users.

This patch doesn't solve the problem fundamentally which need further

1. The tests being moved in Kilo.
2. Not having commit 152fb73a3 in stable/juno, this is why we
   remove the volume entry from the expected return data.
3. Not having commit 96195d51f in stalbe/juno, this is why we
   aren't using objects in the test and have to explicitly

commit_message:
libvirt: partial fix for live-migration with config drive

In current version of nova, live-migration with config drive on
local disk is forbidden due to the bug of libvirt of copying readonly
disk. However, if we use vfat as the format of config drive,
the function of live-migration works well.

In this patch, we re-open the function of live-migration to admin users.
Notice you should add 'config_drive_format=vfat' in nova.conf explicitly.

This patch doesn't solve the problem fundamentally which need further
efforts, but offers a simple and feasible workaround to user.

DocImpact

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(symonds): The conflicts are due to:
        not using is_shared_instance_path or is_shared_block_storage in stable/icehouse.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(symonds): The conflicts are due to:
        libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver().pre_live_migration() returning None on success
            instead of Spice and VNC information.
        not using is_shared_instance_path or is_shared_block_storage in stable/icehouse.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>, Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I7429e12766da7f7f8d484b3a9df6247e832816b0
Partial-Bug: #1246201
(cherry picked from commit 7c4be65733e48dcf44bc306ab964fafb71b37774)

This patch replaces Nova's magical metaclass object registry with the
one from oslo_versionedobjects.

Most of the changes here are related to test objects which previously
(and annoyingly) were automatically registered. It takes a more explicit
action to register these now, but also means we don't have to worry
about the version hash tracking picking up such objects.

There is a change to nova.exception here to copy the readonly exception
from the library, which is purely a tactic to reduce the amount of stuff
we have to change in this patch. The next patch will remove that and do
the necessary test conversions.

commit_message:
Replace metaclass registry with explicit opt-in registry from oslo

This patch replaces Nova's magical metaclass object registry with the
one from oslo_versionedobjects.

Most of the changes here are related to test objects which previously
(and annoyingly) were automatically registered. It takes a more explicit
action to register these now, but also means we don't have to worry
about the version hash tracking picking up such objects.

There is a change to nova.exception here to copy the readonly exception
from the library, which is purely a tactic to reduce the amount of stuff
we have to change in this patch. The next patch will remove that and do
the necessary test conversions.

Related to blueprint use-oslo-objects

Change-Id: If3465f995dd05d2c01f01469b3ad9166c8362e8c

commit_message:
Allow rabbit mq kombu ssl configuration

Add the rest of the kombu ssl configuration options.

After this patch goes in, will need to update each cookbook
that uses rabbit mq to add these to the conf file.

Partial-Bug: 1464706

subject: Add get_server_external_ipv4() to meta
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-06 16:52:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add get_server_external_ipv4()

WiP: figure out how we can *know* if neutron is available.
If the provider firewalled the neutron port, but the service is in the
keystone catalog, calling neutron API will cause a timeout, eventually.
That is an unacceptable delay...

On one hand users shouldn't need to know 1k facts about the cloud they
are using, but in this case using a network-provider config in o-c-c can
really save our life. Moreover asking the user to specify what are the
*_source for their cloud (floating_ip_source secgroup_source are the
current 2 examples) is much worse than asking them just 1 thing: what
is your freaking network_provider, nova or neutron?! :)

Change-Id: I099193437d0f45cfda78923349e500e9b2e0e053

commit_message:
Add get_server_external_ipv4() to meta

It turned out we can't rely on get_server_public_ip to get an
externally reachable IP of servers because not always floating IPs
are used and not always are what the caller is looking for.

get_server_external_ipv4() tries hard to provide an IP address of the
given server that can be reached from networks that are external to
the cloud.
Unfortunately from some clouds (or for very particularly configured
servers with multiple interfaces) it could not be possible to
reliably determine those IP addresses.
Those clouds are corner cases that are not supported by
get_server_external_ipv4()

Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Change-Id: I099193437d0f45cfda78923349e500e9b2e0e053

commit_message:
Add default domain to fixture.v3.V3FederationToken

Each ephemeral user is by default a member of service domain called
"Federated". We should reflect this in fixture.v3.V3FederationToken as
well.

Change-Id: I46a68048c4520e8bace4800b7635df3f8d351dd0

commit_message:
Create file /etc/default/neutron-server

Some neutron packages do not create the /etc/default/neutron-server
file, so we need to ensure that it exists to prevent errors when the
file_line resource is run.

Change-Id: I612e7fa5da7eebd8ae759e867eb8be5cebcdbe9d
Related-Bug: #1385517
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Refactor: move PKI-specific tests into the appropriate class

This patch moves PKI and PKIZ specific tests into a PKI specific test
class. The PKIZ test class then inherits those tests from the PKI test
class. The UUID test class no longer has to override the parent class to
skip an irrelevant test.

Change-Id: Iafb038d5ef6e380a0b48f0bc31ed0da5c526492b

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fix this problem.

See:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/189569

Change-Id: I9f88235c58422c420bbd6ba4a3d8c4a5c60db246

commit_message:
Ensure cache keys are a known/fixed length

Do not assume a token_id will result in a sane length for a memcache
key length. In cases such as Fernet, these ids can easily exceed the
limit on memcache key size. This change ensures we always use a SHA256
of the token id passed in, resulting in a fixed length cache key.

Change-Id: I550e0a1b190047438756bbf40490815a5f177ea7
Closes-Bug: #1460225

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-16 18:20:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Nova admin role

Current “admin” role in Nova and other services are pretty static.  A
user with “admin” role has the super admin privilege not only in
Nova, but other services as well.  In most organizations, compute
administrators and administrators from other services are from
distinct group of administrator.  If an organization does not allow
Nova administrators to make changes to say Cinder or Neutron, then
Nova administrators should only have a “Nova specific admin role”,
and not the super ”admin” role.

Enhance Nova policy to include Nova admin role, so that
administrators with Nova admin role can perform Nova administrative
tasks without having to take on the super "admin" role.

Change-Id: Ie8d653eed2fea244be6fa535ed6fd003ea15c2bb

commit_message:
Nova admin role

Current “admin” role in Nova and other services are pretty static.  A
user with “admin” role has the super admin privilege not only in
Nova, but other services as well.  In most organizations, compute
administrators and administrators from other services are from
distinct group of administrator.  If an organization does not allow
Nova administrators to make changes to say Cinder or Neutron, then
Nova administrators should only have a “Nova specific admin role”,
and not the super ”admin” role.

Enhance Nova policy to include Nova admin role, so that
administrators with Nova admin role can perform Nova administrative
tasks without having to take on the super "admin" role.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ie8d653eed2fea244be6fa535ed6fd003ea15c2bb

commit_message:
Move registration of GenericResource to HeatTest

This patch moves registration of GenericResource to the main test class.
There are several places, where original registration was saved:
- heat/tests/autoscaling/test_lbutils.py - need to be consist with type
names of other resources which are used in test.
- heat/tests/test_environment.py - need special type name for testing
  environment mapping.
- heat/tests/test_engine_service.py - need two different types fro mapping.

Change-Id: I33bdaf3d59e573526e5ffa24086ad55be6bbe6ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-10 12:47:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor _update_ips_for_port()

This commit is a preparation step for using pluggable IPAM.
_update_ips_for_port was refactored and splitted into two methods:
- _get_changed_ips_for_port()
  This method contains calculations common for pluggable and
  non-pluggable IPAM implementation, was moved to ipam_backend_mixin.
- _update_ips_for_port()

commit_message:
Refactor _update_ips_for_port

This commit is a preparation step for using pluggable IPAM.
_update_ips_for_port was refactored and split into two methods:
- _get_changed_ips_for_port
  This method contains calculations common for pluggable and
  non-pluggable IPAM implementation, was moved to ipam_backend_mixin.
- _update_ips_for_port
  This method is specific for non-pluggable IPAM implementation, so it
  was moved to ipam_non_pluggable_backend_common.

Other changes:
- _update_ips_for_port now returns namedtuple with added, removed, original
  ips (previously added and original ips were returned).
  List of removed ips is required by pluggable IPAM implementaion
  to apply rollback-on-failure logic;
- removed unused port_id argument from _update_ips_for_port argument list;

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

Change-Id: Id50b6227c8c2d94c35473aece080a6f106a5dfd8

subject: Fixes unstopped console log worked after live migration
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-15 14:52:55.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/livemigrationops.py', 'hyperv/nova/migrationops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_livemigrationops.py'], 'message': 'Fixes unstopped console log worked after live migration

After a live migration is performed, the console.log file
continues to be open at the source host, as the handler was
never stopped.

Stops console log handler for the instance before live migration
is performed.

Change-Id: I866f2159a06497b30b1b8d6d28d699bf0824940a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes unstopped console log worked after live migration

After a live migration is performed, the console.log file
continues to be open at the source host, as the handler was
never stopped.

Stops console log handler for the instance before live migration
is performed.

Change-Id: I866f2159a06497b30b1b8d6d28d699bf0824940a

commit_message:
Change spec tests to use puppetlabs/concat

The puppet-dns module now depends on puppetlabs/concat, not
theforman/concat_native[1]. This patch updates the .fixtures.yml and
adds a fact stub needed by puppetlabs/concat.

[1] https://github.com/theforeman/puppet-dns/commit/b132780f27c9f8bb87ddf476f10d616a4be7d8d3

Change-Id: I36a8ad8fd83136ffc6ec7502a9734af20412897f

commit_message:
spec: pin rspec-puppet to 1.0.1

rspec-puppet (2.0.0) was released yesterday[1], this new version broke
puppet-openstack unit tests (undefined method `resource')[2] as talked on
and in a second time to update your specs to 2.0.0 and rspec 3.x`)

[1] https://github.com/rodjek/rspec-puppet/commit/8459e14807977244c00bdbcf190062c529b63474

(cherry picked from commit 48a850e38f7937e19b687f7a18c6b7d388ea1069)

subject: Modify magnum api context to use user_name and project_name
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-11 20:24:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Pass proper user/project field names to setup_colorized_logging

If DevStack is used to instantiate the magnum plugin, and the
devstack localrc/local.conf has the default values for:
   LOG_COLOR (default value = True)
   SYSLOG (default value = False)
then upon startup (i.e. running DevStack's stack.sh), the magnum devstack
lib calls the DevStack common setup_colorized_logging function, but it is
currently not passing the 'project_var' and 'user_var'
arguments to this function. As a result, the setup_colorized_logging
function is using its default values of "user_name" and "project_name"
when it defines the logging_context_format_string (that in turn gets
configured in /etc/magnum/magnum.conf). Since "user_name" and "project_name"
are not defined in the API context used by Magnum, a KeyError exeption
for the non-existant key "user_name" is generated whenever the magnum
plugin does a logging call.

The fix is to pass "project" and "user" to setup_colorized_logging.

Change-Id: Ia0c34899609735ff9d8b4597101e004e2684657e
Closes-Bug: #1464376
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-15 22:50:06.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/api/hooks.py', 'devstack/lib/magnum', 'magnum/tests/unit/common/test_context.py', 'magnum/common/context.py'], 'message': 'Modify magnum api context to use user_name and project_name

Problem description:
If DevStack is used to instantiate the magnum plugin, and the
devstack localrc/local.conf has the default values for:
   LOG_COLOR (default value = True)
   SYSLOG (default value = False)
then upon startup (i.e. running DevStack's stack.sh), the magnum devstack
lib calls the DevStack common setup_colorized_logging function, but
without passing the optional 'project_var' and 'user_var' arguments to
this function. As a result, the setup_colorized_logging
function uses its default values of "user_name" and "project_name"
when it defines the logging_context_format_string (which in turn gets
configured in /etc/magnum/magnum.conf). The problem is that "user_name"
and "project_name" are not defined in the API context used by Magnum,
so that whenever the magnum plugin does a logging call, a KeyError
exception for the non-existant key "user_name" is generated.

Fix description:
The fix is to modify the Magnum context to use "user_name" and
"project_name" attributes to be consistent with the default context
format string set up by DevStack.

Change-Id: Ia0c34899609735ff9d8b4597101e004e2684657e
Closes-Bug: #1464376
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Modify magnum api context to use user_name and project_name

Problem description:
If DevStack is used to instantiate the magnum plugin, and the
devstack localrc/local.conf has the default values for:
   LOG_COLOR (default value = True)
   SYSLOG (default value = False)
then upon startup (i.e. running DevStack's stack.sh), the magnum devstack
lib calls the DevStack common setup_colorized_logging function, but
without passing the optional 'project_var' and 'user_var' arguments to
this function. As a result, the setup_colorized_logging
function uses its default values of "user_name" and "project_name"
when it defines the logging_context_format_string (which in turn gets
configured in /etc/magnum/magnum.conf). The problem is that "user_name"
and "project_name" are not defined in the API context used by Magnum,
so that whenever the magnum plugin does a logging call, a KeyError
exception for the non-existant key "user_name" is generated.

Fix description:
The fix is to modify the Magnum context to use "user_name" and
"project_name" attributes to be consistent with the default context
format string set up by DevStack.

Change-Id: Ia0c34899609735ff9d8b4597101e004e2684657e
Closes-Bug: #1464376

subject: Use hash path lookup vs path finding
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 01:05:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use hash path lookup vs path finding

When creating a fake symlink to a path just use
hash lookup via `fetch_node` and handle that failing
if the destination nodes does not exist vs. fetching the
parent and linear searching for the existing target
node (which gets slower as the parent node gets
more children).

Part of ongoing blueprint make-things-speedy

Change-Id: I608b90ae58b4e4b6724b7f1bb8faebd118a1ec79
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-12 01:20:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use hash path lookup vs path finding

hash lookup via `fetch_node` and handle that failing
if the destination nodes does not exist vs. fetching the
parent and linear searching for the existing target
node (which gets slower as the parent node gets
more children).

This makes the preparing code using the little speed
test helper on my not-very-fast box change to be the
following:

Old (preparing) - Took 29.724 seconds to run

New (preparing) - Took 21.343 seconds to run

Part of ongoing blueprint make-things-speedy

commit_message:
Use hash path lookup vs path finding

When creating a fake symlink to a path just use
hash lookup via `fetch_node` and handle that failing
if the destination nodes does not exist vs. fetching the
parent and linear searching for the existing target
node (which gets slower as the parent node gets
more children).

This makes the preparing code using the little speed
test helper on my not-very-fast box change to be the
following:

Old (preparing) - Took 29.724 seconds to run

New (preparing) - Took 21.343 seconds to run

Part of ongoing blueprint make-things-speedy

Change-Id: I608b90ae58b4e4b6724b7f1bb8faebd118a1ec79

commit_message:
Revert "Add heat-translator to global requirments projects"

This reverts commit 843eb4e03a39224f587557ebc20f2c6028a48f32.

heat-translator depends on python_dateutils to parse dates,
which is not in global requirements. We should either
add it to global requirements or more likely use oslo.utils.

Change-Id: Iffad676199871d79f6f02f777c5febf9c3e838d4

commit_message:
HP 3PAR Add version checking and logging

Check for the minimum supported hp3parclient. The older ones are
not supported and this minimum fixes a bug.  Log the hp3parclient,
3PAR WSAPI and driver code versions as requested by support.

Change-Id: I32cff4c5d9f71a9d110a9b08f73e064c178c796a
Closes-Bug: #1463552

subject: Add passenv option to tox.ini
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-14 13:07:19.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add passenv option to tox.ini

Tox 2.0 introduced env variable separation, meaning that env vars set
in the env calling tox will not automatically be in the test env. This
breaks some assumptions we have in tempest. This commit adds all the
env vars which are used by testr or tempest directly for running tests
in the hope of making things work on tox 2.0 and older versions.

Change-Id: Icfe4bb5df0e48cbc9fcdbc602656672295d1887e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add passenv option to tox.ini

Tox 2.0 introduced env variable separation, meaning that env vars set
in the env calling tox will not automatically be in the test env. This
breaks some assumptions we have in tempest. This commit adds all the
env vars which are used by testr or tempest directly for running tests
in the hope of making things work on tox 2.0 and older versions.

Change-Id: Icfe4bb5df0e48cbc9fcdbc602656672295d1887e

commit_message:
Use six.reraise() for Python 3 compatibility

Replace "raise a, b, c" with "six.reraise(a, b, c)" to make the Cinder
code compatible with Python 3.

This patch was generated by the raise operation of the sixer tool:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sixer

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: Iab9e12763e2a7641fc2671acdd4f2ff84be584f3

", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Add python_dateutil to global requirements

The TOSCA Orchestration spec from OASIS supports many different
timestamps that are not supported by libraries such as: iso8601
or datetime. python_dateutil has active development, is BSD
licenced, and is python 3 compliant.

The heat-translator project will immediate leverage this new
requirement, and the oslo.utils project can very likely use this
to improve it's timeutils capabilities.

In terms of packaging, the latest version is 2.4.2. Fedora seems
to provide fairly recent RPMs. Ubuntu's LTS versions are
providing older versions (expected), whereas the non-LTS versions
are supporting 2.2.2.

pypi link: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-dateutil
red hat: http://www.rpmfind.net/linux/rpm2html/search.php?query=python-dateutil
ubuntu: http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=python-dateutil

Change-Id: I93d5d6c08dbeb03a791ef035834a0f26ce246fab

commit_message:
Save image data after setting the data

The image's locations are missing when image's are imported using tasks
because the ImportToStore task is not saving the image metadata after
the import. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I43dec450d5fc4bee2131d78dbe3c2b2373c3f739
Closes-bug: #1453068
(cherry picked from commit 4efb56aae9288952bdb0d368a7c307e8524b80d8)

commit_message:
Context: Remove logic for read_deleted and deprecate it

The read_deleted parameter in the Context object is simply unused.
This patch removes associated logic, and for what is worth, adds
deprecation warnings against explicit usage of read_deleted when
creating a context instance, generate an admin context, and
elevating a context instance.

Change-Id: Ic69d22dc229ebe8fac1f6be0c4860d19732505b1
Closes-Bug: #1449462

[{'created': '2015-05-21 17:26:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix Python 3 issues

* Replace unicode with six.text_type
* Replace "raise a, b, c" with six.reraise(a, b, c)
* Replace dict.iteritems() with six.iteritems(dict)
* Replace StringIO.StringIO with six.BytesIO for image content
* Get AssertionError from builtins, don't use the exceptions module
  which was removed in Python 3
* Open configuration file in text mode (not in binary mode) in
  functional tests
* Use absolute imports in artifacts_sample and image_artifact plugins
  instead of relative imports.
* Fix usage of __import__() function: the level parameter expects a
  positive integer, use level=0, not level=-1
* Get the input function from six.moves: use raw_input() on Python 2 and
  input() on Python 3. raw_input() was renamed to input() in Python 3.
* Unpacking parameters in function definition is no more possible:
  unpack the tuple manually in test_glance_replicator.py
* On Python 3, socket.fromfd() now returns directly the right socket
  type. It's not more needed to cast manually the result of
  socket.fromfd().

For more information on Python 3, see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: Iaa1a392590154058eab4645fb288d1534f66e528

commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues

* Replace unicode with six.text_type
* Replace "raise a, b, c" with six.reraise(a, b, c)
* Replace dict.iteritems() with six.iteritems(dict)
* Replace StringIO.StringIO with six.BytesIO for image content
* Get AssertionError from builtins, don't use the exceptions module
  which was removed in Python 3
* Open configuration file in text mode (not in binary mode) in
  functional tests
* Use absolute imports in artifacts_sample and image_artifact plugins
  instead of relative imports.
* Fix usage of __import__() function: the level parameter expects a
  positive integer, use level=0, not level=-1
* Get the input function from six.moves: use raw_input() on Python 2 and
  input() on Python 3. raw_input() was renamed to input() in Python 3.
* Unpacking parameters in function definition is no more possible:
  unpack the tuple manually in test_glance_replicator.py
* On Python 3, socket.fromfd() now returns directly the right socket
  type. It's not more needed to cast manually the result of
  socket.fromfd().

For more information on Python 3, see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: Iaa1a392590154058eab4645fb288d1534f66e528

subject: Fix test_user_create_delete Fail

[{'created': '2015-06-09 16:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/pages/identity/userspage.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_user_create_delete Fail

The integration test for creating and deleting a user fails because
of a problematic global variable in userpage.py. The order of the global
variable caused the fields to be filled in the wrong order so the user never
gets created for the test. The global variable is changed so the test fills

Closes-bug: #1456294
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix test_user_create_delete Fail

The integration test for creating and deleting a user fails because
of a problematic global variable in userpage.py. The order of the global
variable caused the fields to be filled in the wrong order so the user never
gets created for the test. The global variable is changed so the test fills
 in the fields correctly.

Change-Id: I7bebd3ad4bf851b1da8b05183309ed4e27f6b975
Closes-bug: #1456294

commit_message:
corrected the create volume from snapshot

While creating the volume from snapshot via horizon UI, the volume
is not created from snapshot. It is just creating a volume with
same size of the snapshot.

Fixed the condition used if snapshot_id should be passed when
creating volume. The volume_source_type field is empty string if
launched from Volume Snapshot panel.

Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I19ddd572d1a7a028e3ae4dae412ffc54e730e50c
Closes-Bug: #1447288
(cherry picked from commit 690e56e5cfc96540d01d5632fe9264dd6dec7ead)

commit_message:
Fixing data processing operations for alternate webroots

No longer doing a urlresolver.resolve on the path for any
requests.  Instead, we are now using query style params
which is the way the rest of the sahara dashboard does
things.

Change-Id: Iad413bdf618a4f5374df1fd40793c0b609b17d99
Closes-Bug: #1450535
(cherry picked from commit d61a5ccdc6700a4263bf37cfa8072e6228da2f17)

commit_message:
Exclude current volume_type from Volume retype list

Instead of adding an extra check and throw error messages when
the new volume_type is same with the current one, we should
exclude it from the choices list.

Change-Id: Id91c42ed4a73cc7d5aca34242bf4457a58e8496c
Closes-Bug: #1461856

subject: mech_driver: don't pass empty string as tenant_id to ODL
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 7016, 'name': 'Swaminathan Vasudevan', 'email': 'swvasude@cisco.com', 'username': 'souminathan'}, {'_account_id': 11952, 'name': 'Flavio Fernandes', 'email': 'flavio@flaviof.com', 'username': 'ffernand'}, {'_account_id': 15066, 'name': 'Ed Warnicke', 'email': 'hagbard@gmail.com', 'username': 'hagbard'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-13 03:10:20.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/tests/unit/ml2/test_mechanism_odl.py', 'networking_odl/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': "mech_driver: don't pass empty string as tenant_id to ODL

Neutron l3 code(neutron/db/l3_*_db.py) creates ports for
router(gateway, floatingip) with tenant_id=''(empty string).
As result, ODL mechanism driver passes empty string as tenant_id to
ODL where ODL doesn't expect empty string.
The right fix would be fix Neutron side. But it would take a while.
As work around, this patch fill tenant_id by network's tenant_id when
it's empty string.

https://bugs.opendaylight.org/show_bug.cgi?id=3368#add_comment
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1464806

Change-Id: Ifc739efafdbc16911dbf6f36ae5efc9d1be128e8
Partial-bug: #1464807
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
mech_driver: don't pass empty string as tenant_id to ODL

Neutron l3 code(neutron/db/l3_*_db.py) creates ports for
router(gateway, floatingip) with tenant_id=''(empty string).
As result, ODL mechanism driver passes empty string as tenant_id to
ODL where ODL doesn't expect empty string.
The right fix would be fix Neutron side. But it would take a while.
As work around, this patch fill tenant_id by network's tenant_id when
it's empty string.

https://bugs.opendaylight.org/show_bug.cgi?id=3368#add_comment
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1464806

Change-Id: Ifc739efafdbc16911dbf6f36ae5efc9d1be128e8
Partial-bug: #1464807

commit_message:
devstack: do not run update-db on a compute node

When the devstack plugin is run, but q-scv is not
enabled (like on a compute node), we should not
run bgpvpn-db-manage.

Change-Id: I92893b7848cf92d1ab9a476469efdc30928e6bb1

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

commit_message:
[elasticsearch] default trait type to string

when trait mapping is not found, get_events for es backend will
assume the last known type that was mapped. this patch changes that
so it will default to text type if a mapping is not found.

Change-Id: I5c5b263f0160726034dfca59d70d2a6a32585cb5
Closes-Bug: #1453919

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-10 11:34:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add sysfsutils package

  When we calling fuel-createmirror without arguments,
  it removes upstream ubuntu mirrors.
  Since there is no MOS packages that depends on sysfsutils,
  it not going to be installed on local repos.
  But sysfsutils is requested in 'osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig'
  module which generates error.
  We have to add this package to repo persistently.

Change-Id: I6ddfe50e0fb81584e9228d973a67be03c97f2564
Closes-Bug: #1462216

commit_message:
Add 'sysfsutils' package persistenlty

  The sysfsutils is required by 'osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig'
  module that generates the error pointed out by the bug: #1462216.
  This is due to the fact that no MOS packages are depend on
  'sysfsutils' and therefore it is not installed on local repos
  and the `fuel-createmirror' call without arguments removed
  upstream Ubuntu mirrors.

Change-Id: I6ddfe50e0fb81584e9228d973a67be03c97f2564
Closes-Bug: #1462216

commit_message:
Fixes a type check to make it work in Python 3

base64.urlsafe_b64encode always returns a binary type. In Python 2 the
binary type is the same as the string type so the code works fine. In
Python 3 the types are different so the type check fail.

Change-Id: I234215a6ef9ac8a7f76e34014b27d53dda5ccf54

commit_message:
ngReorg - move framework.util.form to validators

It was noted in review of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182909/ that
the naming of framework.util.form was not very good. This patch attempts
to address that.

Change-Id: Ic08ee897a533ba815d91a40239f3343c4e25b006
Closes-Bug: #1458702

commit_message:
Fix KeyError exception when stack snapshot deletion

There is no 'backup_id' data in snapshot if the cinder
volume snapshot failed. This patch will use 'get'
instead __getitem__ to get the 'backup_id' data to avoid
KeyError exception raise.

Change-Id: Iae7e22ccdaf8f48a85d90afac3a38011f14cbd34
Closes-Bug: #1465173

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 8415, 'name': 'Denis M.', 'email': 'lildee1991@gmail.com', 'username': 'dmakogon'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 10295, 'name': 'mariam john', 'email': 'mariamj@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'mariamj'}, {'_account_id': 10440, 'name': 'Alex Tomic', 'email': 'atomic777@gmail.com', 'username': 'atomic77'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}, {'_account_id': 15321, 'name': 'Matthew Van Dijk', 'email': 'mvandijk@tesora.com', 'username': 'mvandijk'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-11 20:42:22.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/pgutil.py'], 'message': "PostgreSQL guest agent can't remove temp file

The postgresql guest agent uses the pgsql COPY TO command to extract
and cache db resultsets in temp files. These are used by the user
management commands like user-create and user-list.

Since the sticky bit is typically enabled on /tmp, attempts to
remove the file with the user running the guest agent service fail
with an 'Operation not permitted' error.

Closes-bug: #1464389
Change-Id: I15452e7a2bc9cb6823ce2154f8c03c6c6a0b988b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
PostgreSQL guest agent can't remove temp file

The postgresql guest agent uses the pgsql COPY TO command to extract
and cache db resultsets in temp files. These are used by the user
management commands like user-create and user-list.

Since the sticky bit is typically enabled on /tmp, attempts to
remove the file with the user running the guest agent service fail
with an 'Operation not permitted' error.

Closes-bug: #1464389
Change-Id: I15452e7a2bc9cb6823ce2154f8c03c6c6a0b988b

commit_message:
Switch badges from 'pypip.in' to 'shields.io'

The badge hosting at 'pypip.in' has been broken for a while
now, it was supposed to be fixed in the following PR(s):

- https://github.com/badges/pypipins/issues/39
- https://github.com/badges/pypipins/issues/38
- https://github.com/badges/pypipins/issues/37

That does not appear to have actually happened and/or is not
getting addressed, so switch to a more reliable badge hosting
site that provides the same badge information.

Change-Id: I2c7ccc4885dcaaf5b3fa83c61ccbdc3097d42816

[{'created': '2015-06-15 14:03:27.000000000', 'files': ['mcagents/erase_node.rb'], 'message': 'Adjust wait to allow erase_node to send response

This change changes the way the erase_node action performs the cleanup
of the disks. We attempt to remount any ext2/3/4 devices as RO and
set the error action to continue. Additionally we are no longer using
sysrq to sync all file systems, reboot all file systems, or sending a
SIGTERM to all processes. Now the disk erase occurs and a sysrq to
reboot the machine after 5 seconds via a forked process. This should
allow for mcollective to send back the response to the fuel node to

commit_message:
Adjust wait to allow erase_node to send response

This change changes the way the erase_node action performs the cleanup
of the disks. We attempt to remount any ext2/3/4 devices as RO and
set the error action to continue. Additionally we are no longer using
sysrq to sync all file systems, reboot all file systems, or sending a
SIGTERM to all processes. Now the disk erase occurs and a sysrq to
reboot the machine after 5 seconds via a forked process. This should
allow for mcollective to send back the response to the fuel node to
acknowledge the erase_node action.

Change-Id: If5ce3d1c2ce99ec422a372bfc30b273583f9fb38
Closes-Bug: 1461074
